title: Registered / Enrolled Nurse
company_info: PeopleSolve is an international search firm recruiting experienced and qualified nurses from around the world. Our program is specifically designed to help Singapore & internationally educated nurses succeed permanently in our strategic partner's healthcare organizations in Singapore and beyond. Since 2021, we have helped 6,000 ++ nurses, healthcare assistants and patient service officers to secure placements in key healthcare locations including hospitals, clinics, community care centres, testing and vaccination centres since 2021. We are a member of the Raffles Medical Group, a leading medical group and the largest private group practice in Singapore, PeopleSolve is committed to adopting fair and merit-based employment practices towards our candidates detailed under Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices ("TGFEP"). We comply with the applicable labour and employment laws and similar laws in Singapore. Our Five (5) Principles of Fair Employment Practices adopted are: (1) Recruit based on Merit (2) Respect candidates (3) Provide fair opportunities (4) Reward fairly (5) Comply with labour laws EA License No: 21C0695
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join a team of well-trained professional staff to administer personalized and quality patient care.
Provide professional nursing care, educate patients and their family, and perform related duties as required.
Coordinate patient care and provide quality nursing care for an assigned group of patients.
Demonstrate competency in clinical nursing skills and knowledge such as performing IV cannulation, venipuncture for blood sampling, IV administration of medical fluids, ECG monitoring and interpretation.
Record and maintain proper accurate documentation of patient's progress and management rendered in the notes, medication records and charts.
Assists doctors and attend to emergency calls whenever necessary.
Maintain a safe and clean environment to the patients.
To assist with counter registration, pack medication, and other work to be assigned.
To assist with opening and closing of the clinic.
Complete ad-hoc tasks and other duties, as assigned by supervisor.

Assignment to be extended subject to mutual agreement.

What Were Looking For
Someone who is caring, has empathy, and can pay attention to the details, for the needs of their patients.
Passionate, compassionate and ready to assist patients who may need to stay in a medical facility or for a longer-term stay.
Diploma/Bachelors Degree in Nursing.
Valid Practising Certificate with SNB.
Able to commit at least three (3) rotating shifts on a roster.

You may also visit our career page at https://www.careers-page.com/peoplesolve

Find out more about us at https://peoplesolve.com.sg/

Christobel James

PeopleSolve Pte Ltd

title: Enrolled Nurse
company_info: Grace Lodge was set up by the late Venerable Yen Pei in January 1985 with the mission to provide shelter and care for the needy elderly, regardless of race or religion. We are a voluntary and charitable home with a 300-bedded facility.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose Statement
To provide direct nursing care to residents under the guidance of a registered nurse.

Main Duties & Responsibilities:
• Assist residents with their personal hygiene including showering, skin care, oral care and eye toilet
• Assist to prepare and serve meals to the residents
• Ensure tube feeding residents are fed according to schedule
• Assist Staff Nurse to serve medication to residents
• Provide medical care to the residents including changing dressing, applying eye drops, serving supplements to residents
• Observe and monitor residents' medical conditions including skin infection, sores, bowel problems and report abnormal parameters to Staff Nurse for follow up whenever necessary
• Ensure compliance to nursing procedures at all time
• Assist during Doctor's round
• Carry out weekly routine tasks e.g. taking BP and weights of residents
• Make frequent rounds to ensure residents are well and safe
• Ensure safety of residents at all times, especially high risk residents
• Ensure economical use of supplies & consumables and check for expiring dates
• Assist in sending residents to hospital for checkup
• Any other duties as assigned

Qualification Requirements:
• NITEC in Nursing or equivalent
• Registered with the Singapore Nursing Board
• Preferably with 1-2 years of relevant work experience

Roles & Responsibilities
To lead the nursing team and related healthcare workers in the ward, and be responsible for the day-to-day operational work flow in the Nursing Department.
Is responsible for the compliance of all nursing standards as stipulated by MOH and SNB.
Leads quality assurance activities to monitor and evaluate the quality and appropriateness of nursing care. Ensures quality audits and planned and conducted periodically. Follow up with areas of corrective improvements.
Ensures written policies and procedures and work process are available and up to date to guide the provision of nursing care.

Direct care of the residents to ensure compliance to standards.

Diploma / Degree in Nursing
Registered Nurse with Singapore Nursing Board
At least 2 years experience in similar position in a nursing home / geriatric ward
Good public relations and communication skills
Proficient in Microsoft Words, Excel, Power Point and Outlook
5 days work week on roster

title: Nurse Educator
company_info: Touching Lives, Transforming Care We are IHH, one of the world’s largest healthcare networks, with 80 hospitals in 10 countries. We believe that making a difference starts with empathy and putting our patients’ needs first to build lasting relationships based on trust. From everyday care to the little acts that warm the heart, we always deliver our best with genuine compassion – one patient, one family, one touch at a time. With our unique reach and scale, we strive to continuously raise the bar in healthcare across multiple geographies and create synergies throughout our network. We offer our patients a full spectrum of integrated healthcare services across our portfolio of trusted healthcare brands. As we build on what we do well and share our strengths and resources globally, we are making healthcare better, faster, easier and more affordable for our patients.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements
Enhance knowledge, critical thinking, skills and competence of nurses who provide care on the clinical units. Develop, implement and evaluate clinical-based education to meet the competency and learning needs of all levels of nurses. Participate in nursing initiative and evidence-based nursing practices to maintain quality of nursing care and good patient outcome.
Develop, implement and evaluate clinical-based education to meet the competency and learning needs of all levels of nurses.
Facilitate induction, supervise and support nursing students, new graduate RNs and newly employed nurses within the unit by delivering an appropriate induction and Continuing Nursing Education program. This will require preceptoring of nurses.
Perform clinical supervision and regular assessment of nurses’ competencies to ensure achievement of targets set.
Collaborate with the Nurse Leaders and take the lead with learning-needs assessment; planning, implementation and evaluation of competency-based educational and training initiatives.
Collaborate with the Nurse Managers (NMs), Nurse Clinicians (NCs) and other Nurse NEs on any relevant staff development, clinical-based in-service and continuing education for the clinical units and hospitals.
Design curriculum, incorporating active and creative learning methods, evaluation and innovation in nursing education.
Role model the desired team and leadership behaviors.
Update and maintain training statistics.
Perform other assigned duties as required.
SNB Registered Nurse Practicing Certificate
Post-Basic Specialty Certificate/ Advance Diploma in Nursing Specialty
Certificate/Post Graduate Diploma in Higher Education
Nursing Administration/ Management/ Education Degree Qualification (desirable)
At least 2-4 years’ experience as a Nurse Educator II
Specialty experience preferred
Knowledge of current trends in nursing practice
Experience as a preceptor/nurse clinician preferred
Desired leadership behavior demonstrated
Clinical and technical competency
Coaching and mentoring ability
Ability to lead/work in teams

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Scrub Nurse - Surgery Center / Paragon / Experience assisting operating theatre
Salary: $3500 - $5000
5.5 days, alternate Saturday upon confirmation, staggered hours 8 hours depending on roster plan (7am - 7pm)
Location: Paragon Orchard

Job Scope:
Prepare and perform all surgical procedures in a sterile manner, observing all principles of asepsis and sterility.
Coordinate and prepare surgical equipment, instrument and consumables specific to the daily surgical list and preferences of surgeon
Conduct a full count of instruments and accessories before the start of an operation, after the closure of any major cavity, and the end of the operation
Handle all sharps and contaminated waste in a safe and effective manner
Participate in the assisting of safe anaesthetic care for general, regional and deep sedation anaesthesia
Perform scrubbing, circulating and recovery duties
Provide pre & post-operative care for patients
Assist with cleaning and transferring of patient to the recovery area
Carry out proper housekeeping in accordance to Infection Control Standards
Manage Operating Theatre facility
Assist with the cleaning of the operating room
Scrub Nurse duties
Performs any other duties as assigned
Job Requirements:
Candidate must possess Diploma/Degree in Nursing from a recognised institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board
SNB registered Nurse
At least 2 years of experience in healthcare operating theatre settings
Have experience in Endo / Eye surgery preferred

job_category: Environment / Health, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be an integral part of the team in Care Home to provide classroom and on-the-job training to both clinical and non-clinical staff. You will be responsible of the Induction program for new clinical staff on board.

Job Scope :
Train new clinical staff to ensure and promote quality patient care
Provide timely training schedules as requested/ required
Work, coordinate and support with different institutions (e.g. ITE, AIC, TTSH etc.) to provide training to Support Care Staff
Guide and support assigned Support Care Staff who are in ITE-ISC (ITE Skills Certificate) Healthcare program
Review and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and educational activities for ITE educational programs
Review and revise nursing training curriculum on a regular basis to ensure it meets the current and future educational needs
Utilize best practice standards and guidelines to improve clinical education

Clinical Care
a. Assists the registered nurses in the delivery of nursing care to the residents in the Home.

title: Senior / Nursing Aide
company_info: VANGUARD HEALTHCARE PTE. LTD. Set up by the Ministry of Health and MOH Holdings in 2015, Vanguard Healthcare aim to spread good practices, encourage other players to adopt innovations and enhanced practices and develop their manpower, so as to benefit the overall eldercare sector and boost its development over time. We plan to operate five nursing homes by 2020, with approximately 1,000 beds for patients entitled to medical subsidies.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As part of the Nursing Workforce for the Care Home, the Senior / Nursing Aide/ Assistant will assist both the Senior / Staff Nurse and Senior / Enrolled Nurse in the delivery of required and optimal level (quality care) of healthcare services, based on the defined care model, to residents in the home(s).

Basic Nursing Care:
Perform basic nursing care support activities to assist residents with the individualised care program by participating in supervised ‘specific’ procedures relating to resident care as instructed by the Registered Nurse or appropriate therapist (e.g., Naso-gastric tube feeding, simple wound care, instillation of eye drops, application of topical creams etc.).
Assists residents to manage common age-related conditions such as incontinence and loss of mobility.
Adhere to safe work practices and the policy, values and procedures set out within the care home facility.
Work with multi-disciplinary team to analyse and evaluate nursing care plan and ensure care plan is implemented by team.
Assist in transferring residents who may have problems with mobility using appropriate transfer and ‘lifting’ techniques.
Provide general observation support to nursing staff, to inform them about any patient anomalies such as overall outlook, skin condition and discrepancies in behaviour.
Maintain tidiness and cleanliness of the ward and the Care Home.
Perform simple maintenance exercises as prescribed by a registered therapist.
Facilitate and carry out patient centric activities organised by senior staff.
Provide guidance to HCA during service delivery to ensure that service is delivered in a safe and proper manner.
Conduct spot-checks/audits on HCA to ensure that service standards are maintained.
Perform administrative roles such as admission, transfer, medical appointment, and discharge of residents.
Any other duties as assigned by the Nurse Manger or Senior Nurse Manager.
Senior Nursing Aide/Assistant are expected to take on expanded role, such as service and quality activities as well as any additional scope as assigned by the Nursing Management Team.
When required, to stand in as a Facility Assistant (Laundry)
Carry out appropriate laundry collection and distribution.
Carry out pre-treatment of heavily soiled linen.
Carry out ironing and folding of linen.
Ensure clear labelling of residents’ clothing.
Ensure proper handling of washers, dryers, and chemicals.
Sew buttons and torn linen/clothes when required.
Report any maintenance deficiencies detected within the laundry area to the Operations Executive.
Ensure laundry supplies are adequate to meet the daily needs of the Care Home.
Keep work areas free of hazardous conditions.
Ensure that laundry tools / equipment is cleansed and properly stored after usage.
To assist with laundry count/audit.

When required, to stand in as a Facility Assistant (Kitchen)
Work with vendors to receive food.
Conduct plating activities.
Assist in the maintenance of food hygiene (storage of food, food temperature maintenance, food preparation).
Upkeep environmental cleanliness (washing of dishes and cutlery), including daily cleaning and weekly deep cleaning.
Ensure proper handling of chemicals.
Report any maintenance deficiencies detected within the kitchen to the Operations Executive.
Ensure kitchen supplies are adequate to meet the daily needs of the nursing home.
Keep work areas free of hazardous conditions. Ensure that kitchen tools / equipment are cleansed and properly stored after usage.
Work with the Operations Manager to audit the kitchen facilities.
Educational Requirements:

Preferably GCE O-Level or with an HMI Certificate in Healthcare support (Nursing).
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Team player, willingness to learn and self-motivated.
Be able to work rotational 12-hours shift.
At least 3 years of working experience, preferably with experience in rehab services or nursing homes.

title: Senior / Enrolled Nurse
company_info: Woodlands Health Campus (WHC) broke ground on 18 April 2017. The 1,800-bedded facility will comprise a fully-integrated Acute and Community Hospital, Specialist Outpatient Clinics and an Intermediate & Long-Term Care facility. Our vision for the single-build Campus will have both acute and community hospitals sharing the same building and medical teams. This will allow patients to move seamlessly from acute to rehabilitative care, with a unified care team. Our 'future-ready' Campus will employ practical technology to augment manpower needs to deliver care that is safe and more effective. Data analytics, telehealth, automation of manual processes or logistics robots are just some of the potential solutions WHC will use. We are already serving patients in our pre-operations wards located at the Yishun Health campus. Be part of a team providing person-centric, quality care to improve the lives of our patients, community and healthcare family. Similarly, our work in the community has already begun. Since 2015, we have been working with community care providers to create an ecosystem of support for some 600,000 residents in the North of Singapore. We work closely with stakeholders including schools, Voluntary Welfare Organisations, and social and primary care providers to develop initiatives on health promotion, education and engagement.

address: ESR BIZPARK @ CHANGI, 8 CHANGI BUSINESS PARK AVENUE 1 486018
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Brief Description
To be responsible for the delivery of professional, effective and timely clinical services for school staff and students. The health care support meets a high standard of clinical excellence in partnership with the local and regional teams.

B. Key Responsibilities
Clinical Duties
Provide first aid treatment and primary healthcare a nurse’s capabilities
Provide basic stabilisation and triage to major cases within a nurse’s capabilities
Provide documentation, reports of cases seen
Communicate with both International SOS medical staff and client regarding clinical information
Provide health-related education in both individual and group settings
Oversee infection control measures within clinic site
Assist in management of clinic site including but not limited to medical supplies, status of medical equipment, equipment checks etc.
Participate and process pre-participation screening as directed
Administer OTC medication
Case Escalation
Escalation as per International SOS protocol to the Coordinating Doctor on duty for International SOS Singapore Assistance Center.
Medical Transportation – As Required
To work collaboratively with the operations medical team throughout the period of patient movement.
To work within the standard operating procedures to facilitate authorization and communication advisement throughout the period of patient medical evacuation and admission / discharge to / from the treating facility.
To participate in the medical training of internal and external escort nursing team members.
Participate and support the Medical Transportation Standards through the process of audit and case review to ensure compliance.
Participate in the Medevac on call duties for escort team coordination and nursing duties as required.
Occupational Health & Safety Responsibilities (OH&S)
Participate in the development and maintenance of a safe and healthy workplace.
Undertake all mandatory OH&S training as required.
Comply with any reasonable instructions, policies, procedures or safe work practices given by Intl.SOS in adhering to safe work procedures.
Co-operate with management in its fulfilment of its legislative obligations.
Take reasonable care to ensure their own health and safety and the safety of others.
To report any injury, hazard or illness as soon as possible to their supervisor.
Required Skills and Knowledge
Experience of working in the acute care clinical setting, preferably ICU/ER for a period greater than 2 years.
Experience with trauma.
Able to demonstrate clinical leadership and application of a team focused approach in the clinical setting.
The ability to prioritize medical information and produce clinical recommendations for clients.
Prior medical assistance experience, desirable but not essential.
Computer literate in MS Office Applications and Windows applications.
Keyboard skills (desirable)
Professional written and verbal communication skills
Customer /client focused approach to clinical care.
Confidence in clinical decision making.
Experience of scholastic organizations, desirable but not essential.
Required Work Experience
Registered Nurse (Diploma or Degree)
Minimum 2 years of ward experience in either General Ward, Emergency Department or Intensive Care Unit
Must hold registration to practice in country of origin.

title: Staff Nurse
company_info: International SOS is the world’s leading international healthcare, medical and security assistance, and concierge services company. Operating in over 70 countries, International SOS provides integrated medical, clinical, security, and customer care solutions to organizations with international operations. A global team of over 8,000 employees led by 1,200 full-time physicians and 200 security specialists provides services including planning, preventative programs, in-country expertise and emergency response to 66 percent of the Fortune Global 500 companies.
address: ESR BIZPARK @ CHANGI, 8 CHANGI BUSINESS PARK AVENUE 1 486018
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A. Overall Purpose Of The Job
· To be responsible for the delivery of professional, effective and timely clinical services for International SOS Clients. The health care support meets a high standard of clinical excellence in partnership with the local and regional teams.

B. Key Responsibilities
Clinical Duties
Provide first aid treatment and primary healthcare a nurse’s capabilities
Provide basic stabilization and triage to major cases within a nurse’s capabilities
Provide documentation, reports of cases seen
Communicate with both International SOS medical staff and client regarding clinical information
Provide health-related education in both individual and group settings
Oversee infection control measures within clinic site
Assist in management of clinic site including but not limited to medical supplies, status of medical equipment, equipment checks etc.
Participate and process pre-participation screening as directed
Administer OTC medication
Case Escalation
Escalation as per International SOS protocol to the Coordinating Doctor on duty for International SOS Singapore Assistance Center.
Medical Transportation – As Required
To work collaboratively with the operations medical team throughout the period of patient movement.
To work within the standard operating procedures to facilitate authorization and communication advisement throughout the period of patient medical evacuation and admission / discharge to / from the treating facility.
To participate in the medical training of internal and external escort nursing team members.
Participate and support the Medical Transportation Standards through the process of audit and case review to ensure compliance.
Participate in the Medevac on call duties for escort team coordination and nursing duties as required.
Additional Responsibilities
To work within and promote all International SOS’s policies, procedures and corporate values.
To be aware of International SOS’s policies, practices and procedures and actively participate in the ongoing development and enhancement of these important areas of our business.
Be responsible for own Continuing Professional Education (CPE). International SOS will endeavor to support appropriate Continuing Professional Education requests.
Attend supervision, training and departmental meetings as and when required.
All employees are responsible for ensuring compliance with all EEO and OH&S requirements and keeping the workplace safe, free of harassment, discrimination, bullying and hazard free at all times.
Occupational Health & Safety Responsibilities (OH&S)
Participate in the development and maintenance of a safe and healthy workplace.
Undertake all mandatory OH&S training as required.
Comply with any reasonable instructions, policies, procedures or safe work practices given by Intl.SOS in adhering to safe work procedures.
Co-operate with management in its fulfilment of its legislative obligations.
Take reasonable care to ensure their own health and safety and the safety of others.
To report any injury, hazard or illness as soon as possible to their supervisor.
C. Job Profile
Required Skills and Knowledge
Experience of working in the acute care clinical setting, preferably ICU/ER for a period greater than 2 years.
Experience with trauma.
Able to demonstrate clinical leadership and application of a team focused approach in the clinical setting.
The ability to prioritize medical information and produce clinical recommendations for clients.
Prior medical assistance experience, desirable but not essential.
Computer literate in MS Office Applications and Windows applications.
Keyboard skills (desirable)
Professional written and verbal communication skills
Customer /client focused approach to clinical care.
Confidence in clinical decision making.
Experience of scholastic organizations, desirable but not essential.
Required Competencies
Leadership
Upholds ethics and values; Demonstrates integrity; Establishes effective relationships with clients and staff; Motivates and empowers others; Effective communication which encourages clear dialogue, debate and reflection to promote and discuss ideas in the pursuit of positive outcomes. Strong communication skill with ability to take a detailed history of a medical event and provides an accurate report.
Teamwork
Demonstrates an interest in and understanding of others; Develops and maintains good relationships with colleagues and contacts external to the organization; Relates well to people at all levels; Listens, consults others and communicates proactively; Supports others, mentors and guides new team members in their role.
Quality of Service
Focuses on customer needs and satisfaction; Sets high standards for quality and quantity; Monitors and maintains quality and productivity; Works in a methodical way to achieve positive outcomes; Applies clinical knowledge to decision making; Maintains continual professional development; Shares expertise and knowledge in the pursuit of positive outcome and application of evidenced based clinical practice.
Efficiency
Makes prompt, clear decisions which may involve tough choices or considered risks; Takes responsibility for actions, projects and people; Takes initiative, acts with confidence and works under own direction; Initiates and generates activity.
Coping with Pressure and Setbacks
Works productively in a pressurised environment; Keeps emotions under control during difficult situations; Balances the demands of a work life and a personal life; Maintains a positive outlook at work; Handles criticism well and learns from it.
Required Work Experience
Registered Nurse (Diploma or Degree)
Minimum 2 years of ward experience in either General Ward, Emergency Department or Intensive Care Unit
Required Qualifications
Must hold registration to practice in country of origin.
Current certification in BCLS, AED and EPIPEN administration.
Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing board.
Required Languages
· Written and spoken English.

title: Nurse, Occupational Health
company_info: GLOBALFOUNDRIES, the world's first full-service semiconductor foundry with a truly global manufacturing and technology footprint, is executing its Vision to reshape the semiconductor industry through collaboration and innovation. Launched in March 2009 through a partnership between AMD and the Advanced Technology Investment Company (ATIC), GLOBALFOUNDRIES provides a unique combination of advanced technology, manufacturing excellence and global operations. With the integration of Chartered Semiconductor in January 2010, GLOBALFOUNDRIES significantly expanded its capacity and ability to provide best-in-class foundry services from mainstream to the leading edge. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is based in Silicon Valley with manufacturing operations in Dresden, Germany; Malta, New York, and Singapore. These sites are supported by a global network of R&D, design enablement, and customer support operations in Singapore, China, Taiwan, Japan, the United States, Germany, and the Netherlands. For more information on GLOBALFOUNDRIES, visit www.globalfoundries.com GLOBALFOUNDRIES is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action (EEO/AA) employer Minorities/Female/Disabled/Veteran (M/F/D/V).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About GlobalFoundries
GlobalFoundries is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GlobalFoundries makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. For more information, visit www.gf.com.

Introduction
Occupational Health Nurses describe as someone who “provides for and delivers health programs and services to workers and worker populations to promote health & wellbeing. The practice focuses on promotion and restoration of health, prevention of illness and injury, and protection from work-related and environmental hazards. Workplace activities might include health and wellness activities, case management, ergonomics, pandemic preparedness, infection control and others such as travel health.

Your Job
Responds to emergency situations and render first aid treatment and medical support assistance
Handle case management of occupational injuries and illnesses
Responsible for overall technical and administrative operations of the in-house clinic
Partake in Occupational Health Practices; including but not limited to Workplace ergonomics assessment, data collection, health education, etc.
Contribute to the provision of training, advice, health surveillance, vaccinations, sickness absence management, investigations of cases of occupational ill health, and other general OH issues
Partake in OFA (Occupational First Aid Training) as a trainer/assistant trainer.

Required Qualifications:
Preferably Registered Nurse (RN/AN). A Specialist diploma in occupational health would be advantageous, although not compulsory
At least 3 years of nursing experience, For candidates with hospital experience, Accident & Emergency or Intensive Care Unit experience would be advantageous
Familiar in MS office (e.g. Excel, Word, Powerpoint, PDF, etc.

Preferred Attributes
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Effective in problem analysis and decision making – identifying problems, recognizing symptoms, root causes, making timely and sound decisions.
Team player mentality with ability to work on own initiative with minimal supervision.
Ability to work effectively under pressure and challenges.

GlobalFoundries is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard.

As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities.

All offers of employment with GlobalFoundries are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, medical screenings as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations.

To ensure that we maintain a safe and healthy workplace for our GlobalFoundries employees, please note that offered candidates who have applied for jobs in Singapore will have to be fully vaccinated prior to their targeted start date. For new hires, the appointment is contingent upon the provision of a copy of their COVID-19 vaccination document, subject to any written request for medical or religious accommodation.

title: Staff Nurse (Hospice Care or HomeCare)
company_info: Metta Welfare Association The Metta Welfare Association (Metta) was founded in 1992 by Venerable Shi Fa Zhao, Abbot of the Golden Pagoda Buddhist Temple. He is also the President and Abbot of the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum. Registered as a charity in 1994, Metta is presently endorsed by the Ministry of Social and Family Development, Ministry of Health and Ministry of Education. We are also members of the National Council of Social Service, Singapore Hospice Council and Singapore Disability Sports Council. Motto Compassionate love to share Brightens hope to those we care Mission & Objectives To provide accessible and affordable medical care to the less fortunate – home hospice care for the terminally ill and day rehabilitative services for elderly and stroke patients To provide disability care, respite care, residential care and training for the intellectually disabled To provide special education and training for children with mild intellectual disability and/or autism To provide community care services for the elderly, students and children To develop and provide such forms of medical care and welfare services as required by the community
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Metta Hospice Care (慈光安宁居家护理中心) is a member of Singapore Hospice Council and Asia Pacific Hospice Network. Set up in June 2000 to offer free home hospice care to the terminally ill of all ages and races, we have since helped more than 5000 patients to live with quality and dignity throughout the last phase of their lives at the comfort of their homes.
We primarily take care of patients who are referred from medical institutions and general practitioners. They are diagnosed with life-limiting illnesses such as cancer and end stage renal failure and usually have a prognosis of less than a year.
We provide a holistic care approach with medical consultations and nursing assessments to our care recipients, as well as psychosocial support to them and their families. Our Social Worker will also support our care recipients and their families on the emotional and social aspects if required.
Our team comprises of two locum doctors, three full-time staff nurses, a social worker, a community engagement officer, two administrative staff, a Medical Care Assistant Manager and a Medical Care Manager.
As a Staff Nurse, the candidate is responsible in the following areas:
To perform home visits to palliative care patients who are being referred.
To perform nursing assessment on the patients.
To initiate nursing care plan and implement new measures of management.
To adjust current medication to achieve maximum symptom control under doctor’s instruction.
To work closely with the Medical Director/Outsourced doctors on the cases.
To educate caregivers/families on basic nursing procedures to ensure comfort and care.
To refer patients to other professional bodies such as inpatient hospice when the need arises for symptom control or respite care.
To identify patients and families in need of financial assistance and refer to social worker/counsellor.
To identify patients and families in need of specialized counseling to the relevant professionals.
To prepare families for approaching death.
To provide family with the emotional and bereavement support when necessary
Metta HomeCare (慈光居家护理服务) started in April 2015 as a pilot programme with Eastern Health Alliance to support the medical and nursing component of care in the community. It is a home-based service that provides a holistic approach of managing patients with chronic illnesses and organ failure.
Metta HomeCare provides a holistic approach to managing patients with chronic illnesses and organ failure. Our goal is to render early intervention and medical assistance with an individualised care plan to reduce the frequency of re-admission into the hospital. This allows our elderly to age in the comfort of their homes, regardless of race and religion.
As a Staff Nurse, the candidate is responsible in the following areas:
To perform home visits to chronic ill patients who are being referred.
To perform nursing assessment on the patient.
To coordinate with doctor for medical assessment and follow-up visits to patient.
To monitor current medication and compliance as prescribed by the doctor.
To perform nursing procedures such as wound dressing, insertion of urine catheter, insertion of naso-gastric tube and care of tubings as required.
To have proper documentation of the cases seen.
To update the home visits record in the IT system.
To upkeep the confidentiality of the patients seen and adhere compliance with PDPA.
To initiate nursing care plan and implement new measures of management.
To educate caregivers/families on basic nursing procedures to ensure continuation of care at home.
To coordinate with referring healthcare institution on care management.
To identify patients and families in need of financial assistance and refer to the Medical Social Worker/Counsellor.
To identify patients and families in need of psychological support or counseling and refer to the Medical Social Worker/Counsellor.
To participate in Metta Fund raising activities when the need arises.
Requirements
Experience
Minimum 1 year of nursing experience as a registered nurse in various healthcare settings
Qualifications
Diploma in Nursing (Minimum)
Post-graduate or Advance diploma preferred
Other Requirements
Registered with Singapore Nursing board
Valid BCLS and AED certification
Completed Covid-19 vaccination

title: Nurse Clinician (Tampines Nursing Home)
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
NTUC Health Co-operative Limited (NTUC Health) is an NTUC social enterprise that provides a comprehensive and integrated suite of quality and affordable health and eldercare services to meet the growing needs of families and their dependents. Building on more than four decades of experience and expertise, NTUC Health is among the largest senior day care, nursing home and home personal care providers in Singapore. It also offers other services for seniors such as an active ageing hub, senior activity centres, community support for vulnerable seniors, and a sheltered / senior group home. In addition, it runs a chain of dental clinics, and a family medicine clinic
RESPONSIBILITIES
The Nurse Clinician, coordinates and implement care, teaching and counselling to ensure personalised and cost-effective care is provided by nursing staff to residents in accordance to established policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices.  Responsible for clinical practice and staff competency in the ward assigned.
Primary Responsibilities and Duties (80%)
Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care of resident with complex healthcare needs according to updated standards of nursing practice.
Conducts teaching and counselling for residents and their families/carers.
Initiates and ensures implementation of discharge planning for residents with potential for discharge.
Ensures residents care delivery is carried out according to established standards of care and practice.
Ensures written policies and SOP is available and up to date to guide nursing practices.
Provides direct care to residents to ensure compliance to standards
Ensures smooth transition of residents from acute to chronic care and back to community where possible.
Conducts nursing audits on nursing care standards and initiates strategies to resolve non-adherence issues.
Directs and facilitates staff development, skills and competency upgrading through in-house training, approved online learning or formal education opportunities.
Guides orientation/induction programmes and preceptorship for new staff.
Supports the SNM in nursing home management and deputizes her in her absence.
 Secondary Responsibilities and duties (20%)
Acts as a resource person to the nurse manager in clinical nursing and nursing training matters.
Promotes evidence-based practices or nursing care delivery.
Demonstrates awareness of current nursing and health care practices
Monitors and analyzes trends and changing needs of residents in institutional settings.
Conducts quality improvement/research projects
Champions training/quality improvement projects    
Contributes to performance appraisals of staff nurses, assistant nurses, nursing aides and healthcare assistants.
Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/Director of Nursing.
QUALIFICATIONS
Locally Trained Registered Nurse with Advanced Diploma in Nursing/Bachelor’s degree in Nursing or equivalent preferred.
Foreign Trained Registered Nurse with Degree or Diploma in Nursing with Board Pass (Professional Regulation Council, PRC)
Registration with Singapore Nursing Board
OTHER INFORMATION
Location: Tampines Nursing Home
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - NTUC Health

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities

title: Staff Nurse
company_info: Established since 1987, ECON Healthcare Group celebrates more than 30 years of commitment to quality healthcare and eldercare services this year. As a regional provider for integrated healthcare servcies in Singapore, Malaysia and China, the Group incorporates a chain of medicare centres and nursing homes, hospital services, a careskill training centre, a chain of senior services centres, home care services, ambulance services, physiotherapy services and traditional Chinese medicine services. The Group also provides consultancy for the development and management of retirement living communities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Clinical Nursing Quality and Safety
Provide a consistent and excellent clinical and service quality to residents and sponsors.
Responsible for the clinical quality of all residents guided by the set 4 Zeros clinical indicators – Zero Falls, Zero Medication Errors, Zero Nursing Home Acquired Pressure Ulcers and Zero Nursing Home acquired infection.
Clinical Care
Responsible for the safe delivery of care and clinical decisions to all residents.
Render clinical care and nursing procedures including proper assessment of residents, administration of medications, injections, perform complex wound dressings and monitoring of vital signs.
Responsible for the ordering, packing and preparation of the daily medications for all the residents.
Responsible for the accurate and complete nursing documentation for residents to meet the requirements of the Ministry of Health.
Clinical Supervision
Assist in providing adequate supervision of all staff in carrying out their responsibilities in accordance with the Enhanced Nursing Home Standards (ENHS) guidelines, protocols and standards operating procedures (SOPs).
Provide clinical supervision to all newly recruited staff nurses, enrolled nurses and other junior staff ensuring that they carry out their duties in accordance to the SOPs.
Residents’ Activities
Plan and carry out the daily activities for the residents and maintain an accurate log-book.
Assist the Physiotherapist/Therapist Assistant in their rehabilitation program for the residents and encourage residents’ participation.
Resource Management
Assist in proper management of food costs by cutting wastes and monitor the efficient use of consumables, supplies, dressing materials and diapers accordingly.
Maintain and upkeep a proper inventory control with regular inspection.
Medical Matters
Work closely with the Medical Doctor in reviewing treatment and management of residents’condition.
Feedback Management
Assist in any investigation and resolve all feedback and complaints received from therespective centres.
Other Duties
Assume any other additional responsibilities as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/ NurseManager/Assistant Nurse Manager/Senior Staff Nurses (SNM/NM/ANM/SSN).
Act as a liaison person with the respective hospitals, resident’s sponsors on the dailymedical appointment.
Assist in provision of holistic cleanliness of resident care area.
Deputise for SCM/SNM/CM/NM/ACM/ANM/SSN in her absence.
Maintain an accurate log book on daily activities in the centre
Maintain good communication skills with residents and sponsors.
Qualifications
Locally Trained: Degree or Advanced Diploma or Diploma in Nursing with valid licence from SNB will be an added advantage
Foreign Trained: Degree or Diploma in Nursing with Board Pass (Professional Regulation Council).
State Registered Nurse with valid practicing license issued by the Singapore Nursing Board.
Valid certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS).
At least 2-3 years of post-registration experience, with exposure to geriatric care settings will be an added advantage.
Other Information
Passionate and caring
Good communication skills
Team Player
Analytical Thinking & Decision-Making

title: Senior Staff Nurse
company_info: About SingHealth Community Hospitals SingHealth Community Hospitals (SCH) comprises of Bright Vision Community Hospital, Sengkang Community Hospital and Outram Community Hospital. Being Singapore's only cluster of community hospitals, we aim to deliver a seamless and integrated care path for patients requiring sub-acute care,rehabilitation and palliative care. Our community hospitals are poised to set standards incare, exchange best practices and strengthen collaborations with our healthcare and community partners. A Member of SingHealth Regional Health System SCH is under the SingHealth Regional Health System (RHS) and is supported by the medical expertise and research capabilities of the SingHealth-Duke NUS Academic Medical Centre.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a valuable member of the SCH family, you are an integral part of the care team providing nursing care that matters to rehab and sub-acute patients. Working in a homely environment where there is lesser segregation of duties amongst staff groups, will provide quality nursing care and services in alignment with SCH’s care philosophy of unhurried personalised care. You will facilitate the continuity of care for patients throughout their hospitalisation and transition to home and community.
Diploma or Degree in Nursing or its equivalent
Advanced Diploma / Specialist Diploma / Graduate Diploma in Nursing (Gerontology / Orthopaedic / Neuroscience / Palliative Care / Community Nursing) is preferred for Senior Staff Nurse
At least 3 years experience as Registered Nurse in acute hospital setting
Experience in ILTC setting is an advantage
Valid Registered Nurse practicing certificate issued by Singapore Nursing Board
Valid BCLS certification
Comfortable with shift work (3-rotating shift) and open to deployment within 3 work sites under SingHealth Community Hospitals
Uniform required

title: Clinic Nurse
company_info: Shinagawa Eye Centre has a long history of helping people with eye problems in Singapore. We have a full range of eye care services with advanced diagnostic and surgical devices available at our eye clinic. The AMARIS laser and the Avedro cross-linking devices are expensive high-end equipment to meet the needs of those undergoing LASIK surgery. The luxurious setting of our Centre is complete with operating rooms, consultation rooms, private recovery and resting area designed to help patients feel comfortable and well taken care of. The most important aspect of any health care facility is to have the human touch. Our senior specialist eye doctor has a wealth of experience in treating a wide range of eye conditions. Together with our nurses and optometrists, we provide patients with the highest standard of professionalism and meticulous patient-care.

Job Description & Requirements
Here at Farrer Park Hospital, nursing is more than just a job. Nurses are caregivers, patient advocates and most often, a friend who is always there with a sincere and caring heart.
Farrer Park Hospital is expanding our family of nurses and is now looking for Registered Nurses to join our growing team! If you have a strong passion for nursing and would like to experience a nursing career unlike any other – WE WANT YOU!
As a Senior / Staff Nurse, you shall be responsible to provide professional nursing service of the Inpatient Ward/Suite in accordance with established nursing policies and procedure and standard operating procedures of nursing care and practices.

Key Responsibilities
To provide a high standard of care to patients through care management, assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of nursing care to meet the needs of the patients.
Responsible for the safe delivery of care to patients
Support Nurse Manager/Clinician in ad-hoc task
Requirements
Willing to commit to 3 shifts, on rotation basis.
Minimum Degree / Diploma in Nursing.
Candidates with Advanced Nursing Diploma or equivalent will have an added advantage.
A meticulous and analytical team player with good interpersonal and communication skills.

title: Staff Nurse, Major Surgery
company_info: Developed by The Farrer Park Company, Connexion at Farrer Park will be one of the world’s first truly integrated healthcare and hospitality complexes when it opens in 2014. Professional and end user-driven by objective and design, Connexion comprises Farrer Park Medical Centre, a specialist medical centre; Farrer Park Hospital, a private tertiary hospital; and One Farrer Hotel & Spa, a luxury hotel equipped with state-of-the-art conference and wellness facilities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description

Provide direct quality peri-operative patient care in Major Surgery Suites (MSS), uphold professional standards through continuous education, supervision and development and maintain accurate records.

Key Responsibilities
To assess, plan, implement and evaluate the peri-operative patient care in order to achieve optimum patient outcomes for surgical patients.
To participate in the implementation of clinical practices and standards including utilisation of new technologies, regular clinical nursing audits to ensure high quality standards of peri-operative care being rendered to the patients.
To demonstrate good and competent clinical skills, knowledge and critical thinking in the delivery of quality operating room nursing skills.
To be a team player as part of the MSS team to deliver a high and safe standard peri-operative patient care providing supervision and support where appropriate.
To participate in the care and maintenance of specialised equipment, ensuring an agreed standard of decontamination or disinfection at all times including accurate record for traceability of all equipment.
To actively be involved in committee/s at departmental or hospital level when nominated to represent on term or ad hoc basis.
To participate in the orientation, training and education of junior and newly recruited nurses for continuous professional development and maintaining their level of competencies.

Requirements
Diploma of Nursing or Degree in Nursing or equivalent.
Advance Diploma or post-basic qualifications in Peri-operative Nursing or equivalent.
Singapore Nursing BoardPracticing Certificate for Registered Nurses.
At least 6-8 years experience in hospital clinical settings of which 5 years in Operating Room (OR).
Leadership role in Operating Room.
Possess good clinical knowledge in Operating Room domain.
Good interpersonal skills
Good communication skills (written & oral).
Good clinical skills and knowledge.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Reporting to the Director of Cancer Rehab and Supportive Care Services, you will lead and manage a team of nurses in providing patient care in symptom care, patient and caregiver education. You will triage patients into priority groups and liaise with the hospice care doctors and primary specialists in charge of clinical management. You utilise strong problem solving skills to identify issues and to improve systems and process for the Hospice team.
Responsibilities
Manage a team of 8-10 nurses trained in palliative care
Acclimate new nurses to the team as a preceptor
Ensure that team reviews and adopts measures to achieve KPIs and targets
Ensure compliance to clinical pathways in management.
Manage and maintain adequate stock of medical drugs and equipment.
Preparing the annual team budget in accordance with annual plan
Conduct assessment and devise a plan of care for all new referrals and ongoing homecare cases
Prioritise care in collaboration with patients and caregivers
Provide patient and caregiver education on symptom control and coping skills
Criteria
A state registered Nurse with at least 5 years’ experience in leadership role
At least 8 years in nursing (preferably in a local hospital setting)
Experience in Palliative Care Nursing
Good management and coaching skills
Clinical supervision skills
Conflict management is important

title: Enrolled Nurse
company: PACIFIC HEALTHCARE NURSING HOME PTE. LTD.
company_info: We see the need to collectively build a more sustainable system of care for those, whose hard work has made Singapore the Nation it is today - our revered elderly. Pacific Healthcare Nursing Homes, as a vital part of this mission and duty, are built to provide well-equipped facilities, trained staff and the best possible care to not only enhance the physical wellbeing of our seniors, but to also encourage them to experience the joys of life, social connection and the spirit of community.
address: PACIFIR HEALTHCARE NURSING HOME, 6 LENGKOK BAHRU 159051
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job functions:
1 Provides basic nursing care to the residents in the nursing home.
2 Assists the State Registered Nurse in the delivery of nursing care such as:
· supervision of Nursing Aides (NA) and Healthcare Attendants (HCA)
· supervision and assistance to the rest of care team in the proper transfer/lifting of residents
· assisting residents in their activities of daily living such as personal hygiene, toileting, bathing, grooming and feeding
· promoting education of self-care and independence for residents, ensuring a sense of well-being
· ensuring good standard of housekeeping
3 Carry out nursing rounds with the registered nurse.
4 Ensure the proper delivery of nursing procedures such as dressings, instillation of eye drops, topical creams applications, etc.
5 Assist in the administration of medications and tube-feeding under the supervision of State Registered Nurse.
6 Checks, monitors and records residents’ vital signs such as temperature, pulse, respiration, blood pressure and apex beat.
7 Maintains accurate documentation of care given.
8 Jointly work with the Physiotherapist/Occupational Therapist/Physio-Aide to provide rehabilitative exercises for the residents.
9 Guides the Nursing Aides in observing and recording of nursing care eg report any unusual observations and/or deterioration in resident’s physical condition to the Registered Nurse.
10 Participate in the handling of emergencies (even if off-duty where necessary)
11 Work as a team and respond to residents’ needs which include:-
· answering call bells
· ensuring residents are comfortable, dry and clean at all times
· doing rounds of the residents to check on their conditions
· Supervision and assistance in 2 hourly turning of total dependent residents
· serving and feeding the residents their correct meals/feeds
1 Keep updated on nursing care by reading, attending talks, seminars and lectures.
2 Co-ordinates with other departments such as housekeeping and maintenance to ensure a safe, clean and properly maintained environment.
3 To be on rotating shift and on call whenever necessary.
Any other duties as required by Supervisor.

1.6 Ensure service quality standards and cost-effective services are maintained and enhanced.
1.7 Responsible for the compliance of all nursing standards as stipulated by Ministry of Health, Singapore Nursing Board and Agency for Integrated Care.
1.1 Prepare staff duty roster, leaves administration etc.
1.2 Draw up short and long-term plans (e.g. annual and 5-yearly plans) to accommodate trends in residential nursing care.
1.3 Coordinates with the other departments to ensure smooth delivery of service.
2 Patient Care
2.1 Analyze trends and changing needs of the residents in institutional settings. Plans nursing care based on changing trends.
2.2 Operationalize and monitor the smooth transition of the residents from acute to step-down care.
2.3 Assess, plan, implement and evaluate patient care.
2.4 Oversee the administration of treatment prescribed for residents.
2.5 Plans and conduct therapeutic programs for patients.
2.6 Conduct or make arrangements for health education, counselling for residents and their family members.
2.7 Ensure that care staff deliver expected standard of care.
3 Training and Professional Development
3.1 Teach, mentor and supervise nursing staff in their clinical practice
3.2 Plan, coordinate and provide clinical guidance and supervision to nursing staff
3.3 Conduct regular clinical training and competency assessment for nursing staff to ensure clinical compliance
3.4 Perform clinical nursing audits and suggest interventions for, initiate and participate in clinical quality improvement in care delivery outcome
3.5 Participate in clinical quality improvement initiatives
3.6 Participate in continuing education programs.
3.7 Develop training materials and lesson curriculum when required
3.8 Assist in collating of training data and evaluating training effectiveness
3.9 Assist Nursing colleagues to ensure smooth operations of Nursing Home
3.10 Keep pace with professional trends and practices.
3.11 Participate actively in medical products evaluation.
3.12 Participate in nursing research, where required.
4 Others
4.1 Any other duties assigned by Supervisors
4.2 To back up Nurse Manager / Nurse Educator / Nurse Clinician during their absence

2 vacancies needed at Senja.
1 vacancy needed at Lengkok Bahru.

company_info: St. Andrew's Mission Hospital (SAMH) first began as a free dispensary for poor local and migrant women and children in 1913. Today, SAMH operates St. Andrew's Community Hospital, St. Andrew’s Autism Centre, St. Andrew’s Mission Hospital Clinics, St. Andrew’s Nursing Homes at Buangkok, Henderson and Queenstown and St. Andrew’s Senior Care centres at Kampong Glam, Tampines, Henderson and Queenstown. job_category: Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services, Professional Services, Public / Civil Service, Social Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Rewarding and meaning career in Healthcare
Good benefits
2 or 3 rotating shifts
Location: East
Are you a registered nurse with a passion for providing quality care to patients in a challenging and rewarding environment? Do you have the skills and experience to coordinate, manage and evaluate nursing care for a diverse group of patients? If yes, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Our client manages correctional healthcare services in Singapore, offering comprehensive and holistic care to inmates in Singapore. They are looking for staff nurses who can join their team to deliver safe, effective and patient-centred care.
As a staff nurse, you will:
Provide nursing care and patient education to an assigned group of patients in a correctional healthcare setting
Collaborate with doctors and other healthcare professionals to plan and implement care plans and treatment goals
Assist doctors during clinical procedures, examinations and assessments
Perform simple invasive and noninvasive procedures within your scope of practice
Document patients’ progress, nursing care and treatment outcomes accurately and timely
Assess patients’ needs and develop/implement discharge plans accordingly
Comply with operational and nursing guidelines and safe practices according to the organisation’s standards
Demonstrate core and special competencies in Nursing
To be eligible for this position, you must:
Have a recognised Diploma or Degree in Nursing or its equivalent
Be a State Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board
Able to work on 3-rotating or 12-hour shifts, including weekends and public holidays
Be comfortable to work in a correctional healthcare environment
Have completed COVID-19 vaccinations
Interested applicants, kindly furnish us with your detailed resume in MS Words format and click “Apply Now” button.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilties:
The Product Specialist shall attend the assigned hospital at least one hour prior to each Surgery (or such longer period as specified by the hospital) to ensure that the correct products and instruments (and any other products or instruments of the Company requested by the hospital or the relevant surgeon) are available and ready for use and properly set out according to the specification set out for the Surgery.
Ensure the correct products and instruments of the Company are placed in the operating room ( to avoid leaving the OR nnecessarily during the Surgery.
Shall check that all the products and instruments which are required for each Surgery are sterilized as required and in good working order prior to the Surgery.
Fully prepared in with the scrub policy of the assigned hospital to assist with each Surgery. A detailed surgical hand-to-elbow scrub with a dedicated soap and wearing surgical attire which includes without limitation gloves, gown, head covering and protective eyewear.
Responsible for counting the instruments and materials (such as sponges, needles etc.) to be used in each Surgery. The count shall be made and noted before the first incision is made. The Scrub Technician and circulating nurse shall undertake the count together and shall both sign the relevant documentation to verify the count prior to commencing the Surgery.
Ensure that he/she understands the correct handling and use of all the products and instruments.
The count of products must be repeated immediately following the Surgery with the circulating nurse and the surgeon must be notified of the count.
Ensure that: (i) all the Company’s instruments are cleaned appropriately after each usage and placed in their respective trays and cases by the relevant hospital personnel: and (ii) that the correct number of cases, boxes or trays are returned to the Company’s third-party logistics partner.
Shall inspect all the instruments and returned products for damage (including excessive wear and tear) and/or defects and promptly report any damaged or defective instruments and/or products to the Product Manager and to the third partner logistics partner.
Complete the UID form with confirmed pricing from the sales representative to report on the surgeon and hospital’s usage of product for billing purposes. The assignment is not complete until the UID form is emailed to the third- party logistics partner for billing.
Shall report any market feedback on the products as well as those of the competitors received or observed by the Product Specialist.
Requirements:
min. Diploma in Nursing and registered Nurse or related field
2-4 years’ experience in Operating theater (OT)
Knowledge of clinical segment / product platform preferred
Keen interest in sales
Interested candidates please send in your updated resume to:

kate.leau@recruitexpress.com.sg
Subject: Scrub Tech

title: Registered Nurse
company: ECON NURSING HOME SERVICES (1987) PTE LTD
company_info: Established since 1987, ECON Healthcare Group celebrates more than 30 years of commitment to quality healthcare and eldercare services this year. As a regional provider for integrated healthcare servcies in Singapore, Malaysia and China, the Group incorporates a chain of medicare centres and nursing homes, hospital services, a careskill training centre, a chain of senior services centres, home care services, ambulance services, physiotherapy services and traditional Chinese medicine services. The Group also provides consultancy for the development and management of retirement living communities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Clinical Nursing Quality and Safety
Provide a consistent and excellent clinical and service quality to residents and sponsors.
Responsible for the clinical quality of all residents guided by the set 4 Zeros clinical indicators – Zero Falls, Zero Medication Errors, Zero Nursing Home Acquired Pressure Ulcers and Zero Nursing Home acquired infection.
Clinical Care
Responsible for the safe delivery of care and clinical decisions to all residents.
Render clinical care and nursing procedures including proper assessment of residents, administration of medications, injections, perform complex wound dressings and monitoring of vital signs.
Responsible for the ordering, packing and preparation of the daily medications for all the residents.
Responsible for the accurate and complete nursing documentation for residents to meet the requirements of the Ministry of Health.
Clinical Supervision
Assist in providing adequate supervision of all staff in carrying out their responsibilities in accordance with the Enhanced Nursing Home Standards (ENHS) guidelines, protocols and standards operating procedures (SOPs).
Provide clinical supervision to all newly recruited staff nurses, enrolled nurses and other junior staff ensuring that they carry out their duties in accordance to the SOPs.
Residents’ Activities
Plan and carry out the daily activities for the residents and maintain an accurate log-book.
Assist the Physiotherapist/Therapist Assistant in their rehabilitation program for the residents and encourage residents’ participation.
Resource Management
Assist in proper management of food costs by cutting wastes and monitor the efficient use of consumables, supplies, dressing materials and diapers accordingly.
Maintain and upkeep a proper inventory control with regular inspection.
Medical Matters
Work closely with the Medical Doctor in reviewing treatment and management of residents’condition.
Feedback Management
Assist in any investigation and resolve all feedback and complaints received from therespective centres.
Other Duties
Assume any other additional responsibilities as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/ NurseManager/Assistant Nurse Manager/Senior Staff Nurses (SNM/NM/ANM/SSN).
Act as a liaison person with the respective hospitals, resident’s sponsors on the dailymedical appointment.
Assist in provision of holistic cleanliness of resident care area.
Deputise for SCM/SNM/CM/NM/ACM/ANM/SSN in her absence.
Maintain an accurate log book on daily activities in the centre
Maintain good communication skills with residents and sponsors.
Qualifications
Locally Trained: Degree or Advanced Diploma or Diploma in Nursing with valid licence from SNB will be an added advantage
Foreign Trained: Degree or Diploma in Nursing with Board Pass (Professional Regulation Council).
State Registered Nurse with valid practicing license issued by the Singapore Nursing Board.
Valid certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS).
At least 2-3 years of post-registration experience, with exposure to geriatric care settings will be an added advantage.
Other Information
Passionate and caring
Good communication skills
Team Player
Analytical Thinking & Decision-Making

title: Staff Nurse (Home Care)
company_info: Established since 1987, ECON Healthcare Group celebrates more than 30 years of commitment to quality healthcare and eldercare services this year. As a regional provider for integrated healthcare servcies in Singapore, Malaysia and China, the Group incorporates a chain of medicare centres and nursing homes, hospital services, a careskill training centre, a chain of senior services centres, home care services, ambulance services, physiotherapy services and traditional Chinese medicine services. The Group also provides consultancy for the development and management of retirement living communities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The jobholder is responsible to provide a patient-centric, personalised, specialised and compassionate care to home care clients’ needs, in accordance with established policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices.

Clinical and Psycho-social Aspect:
Conduct initial clinical assessment of new clients
Conduct 6 monthly review of existing clients and, as and when required when condition changes.
Formulate individualised and holistic care plan, and review whenever required
Ensure proper and accurate nursing documentation
Perform nursing procedures in accordance with the core competencies as a Registered Nurse as specified by Singapore Nursing Board
Work closely with multi-disciplinary team comprising of Allied Health Professionals, Registered Medical Practitioner, etc
Liaise and communicate directly with clients and sponsors regarding any issues that may arise and provide solutions
Provide psycho-social support, such as establishing effective communication and understanding their psycho-social needs, etc
Liaise with clients and other stakeholders to refer to other relevant services, such as counselling, occupational therapy, dietetic, etc
Administrative and Operations Support
Handling home care enquiries and provide financial counselling when necessary
Providing administrative support, managing feedback, complaints and identifying situations where clients require additional attention, etc
Collaborating with other related departments, such as IT, finance, etc., to ensure smooth operational flow of the Home Care business
Coordinating clients’ care arrangements, such as rostering, rotating 24 hours on-call basis for emergencies, etc
Achieve the set targets in meeting the profitability of the department
Manpower Development and Support
Provide training and supervision to the team of care staff, when required
Plan and coordinate the assignments of care staff according to their job scope and competencies based on client’s care needs
Assist to manage a team of care staff and monitor their performances and developments
Assist to oversee the well-being of care staff and manage any staff issues, when required, eg. conflict management, clients’ feedback about staff, etc
Quality Service and Incident Management
Lead quality improvement projects and initiatives
Identify risks, mitigate and perform service recovery
Conduct relevant audits in areas of job scope
Manage and report any incident, and escalate when management decision is required
Other Duties
Perform adhoc duties and responsibilities, as assigned by Homecare Head
Cover duties of care coordinator, during his/her absence, if necessary
Requirements:
Possess a Bachelor Degree in related field and/or Degree or Advanced Diploma or Diploma in Nursing will be an added advantage
State Registered Nurse with valid practicing license issued by the Singapore Nursing Board
Valid certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS)
At least 8 years’ experience in management of department and have provide supervision to a team of subordinates

title: Senior / Staff Nurse (Correctional Health)
company_info: Changi General Hospital (CGH) is a trusted healthcare provider with over 800 beds in eastern Singapore. We provide a comprehensive range of medical specialties. CGH offers the entire gamut of medical services, from general surgery, internal medicine, cardiology, ENT to orthopaedic surgery and dermatology. Our peaks of medical excellence are represented by the Integrated Sleep Service, Breast Centre @ changi, Endoscopy Centre, Diabetes Centre, Geriatric Centre and the Changi Sports Medicine Centre. Changi Sports Medicine Centre is Singapore’s largest and is a leading provider of sports medicine expertise. CGH is dedicated to improving the health of the community in the east and to provide excellence and compassion in service and care. To improve care for patients, it has adopted a proactive integrated care approach. Partnering with healthcare providers in the east, it is bringing disease management programmes and disease prevention programmes to patients’ doorstep.
description:

description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Location: Orchard Paragon

Job Summary
Provide clinic patient care.
Assist clinic administration, patient consultation and clinical procedures.
Roles and Responsibilities
Patient Care Management (OT)
Perform check and prepare operating room readily for procedure.
Respect and protect patients’ right and confidentiality.
Assess patient pre operatively and complete patient safety check prior to procedure.
Check and ensure full preparation of set, suture, supplementary possible use of supplies prior to surgery.
Assist patient’s positioning for procedure.
Assist surgeon and anticipate surgeon needs during surgeries.
Assist in anesthesia, recovery, circulating duties and any other duties within the team.
Coordinate with surgeon or anesthetist to ensure smooth running of surgery list.
Collect and prepare specimens for laboratory analysis where necessary.
Provide guidance for new or junior staff to ensure quality-nursing care is rendered.
Implement and maintain the principles of sterility and asepsis for all procedures and techniques.
Comply with established guidelines of infection control practices.
Recognize and intervene in emergency situation involving patient care or other team members.
Document accurately and legibly in relevant patient care records and in billing of consumables and implants
Patient Care Management (Clinical)
Perform patient assessment undergoing procedures
Provide psychological support and comfort to the patient
Prepare supplies and medications required
Assist radiologist or radiographer in ultrasound and mammography procedures
Monitor the patient throughout the procedure
Recovery and discharge of patient according to discharge criteria
Replenish stocks when necessary
Maintain cleanliness of the environment and care of equipment in patient care areas
Perform any other duties as assigned
Job Requirements
Registered Nurse with Singapore Nursing Board
Degree or Diploma in Nursing from a recognized institution
Nurses with prior working experience in clinical settings will be an advantage

title: Senior / Outdoor Nurse Practitioner, Outward Bound Singapore
company_info: At NYC, we believe in a world where young people are respected and heard, and have the ability to influence and make a difference to the world. Together with our partners, we develop future-ready youth who are committed to Singapore by instilling in them a heart for service, resilience and an enterprising spirit.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About National Youth Council (NYC) - Creating Opportunities for All Youth to Be Heard, Be Empowered, Be the Change
At NYC, as the national agency for youth matters, we believe in a world where young people are respected and heard, able to take action on issues that matter and make a positive difference around them. Together with our partners, we develop future-ready youth and deepen their commitment to Singapore by imbuing in them a heart for service, resilience and an enterprising spirit. Find out more at www.nyc.gov.sg.

About Outward Bound Singapore
Outward Bound Singapore (OBS), a division of NYC, is part of a worldwide adventure-based training network in more than 30 countries. We are a leader in outdoor education and have developed more than 500,000 youths over the past 50 years through outdoor programmes. We do not merely impart outdoor skills and knowledge; we seek to inspire individuals and transform communities. Utilising adventure education as a pedagogy, our programmes aim to inspire youths to start a journey of self-discovery, and build confidence and resilience. Our staff have an affinity for the outdoors and passion for developing people.

The Medical Services and Training Unit (MST) run medical centres across OBS’ campuses and deals with all emergencies, injuries and illnesses of OBS’ participants and staff. The Outdoor Nurse Practitioner (ONP) assesses and treats patients out at sea, in the field, and in the medical centre. MST also performs pre-enrolment screening to ensure that all participants are safe to join OBS activities. As part of the outdoor adventure industry, MST conducts and provides wilderness medicine courses to OBS’ operational staff and regional partners.

We are seeking a Senior/Outdoor Nurse Practitioner to join the NYC/OBS family. As a Senior/Outdoor Nurse Practitioner, you will be part of the Medical Services & Training unit to ensure the efficient operations of the OBS Medical Centre by providing timely and effective first-line medical care to participants and staff. You may also be required to perform 24 hours night shift and perform standby activation role during and after office hours, and should be comfortable to work independently and provide medical care in austere work environments (on overseas expeditions, in the field, or out at sea).

For the Senior Outdoor Nurse Practitioner role, you will additionally be expected to lead in medical training and medical-related projects. Such projects may entail working with other units within OBS, other agencies, as well as vendors. Experience in a leadership position and having an exploratory mind is important.

You will be exposed and hone your skills in these areas:
Applying your medical skills and knowledge in a vastly different environment from hospitals or clinics.
Learning and practicing in austere, wilderness, pre-hospital medicine.
Working with youths on a national outdoor adventure programme in a dynamic environment
Primary and Public Health – in dealing with adolescent health, sports medicine, mental health, tropical medicine and population health policies.
Teaching, training, curriculum design
Research and data analytics
Overseas expedition opportunities
Requirements
A Singapore Registered Nurse with Singapore Nursing Board
Minimum 3 years’ experience in pre-hospital, emergency, critical care will be advantageous
Good writing, communication, and creative & critical thinking skills
Possess a macro perspective of issues and an eye for details
Able to adapt well and thrive in a dynamic environment
A team player who is effective, resourceful, and takes the initiative in work.
Additional Requirements for Senior Outdoor Nurse Practitioner:
Been in a supervisory role for at least 3 years (e.g. Nurse Clinician, or equivalent)
Experience in project and contract management
Experience in finance and procurement workstreams and functions
