title: Staff Nurse (Inpatient) (Part-Time)
company: NATIONAL HEART CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE LTD
company_info: NATIONAL HEART CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will assess, plan, implement and evaluate the total nursing care for an assigned group of patients, as well as perform a wide variety of nursing procedures and patient education that meet patients’ needs. You will have opportunities to work in the Cardiothoracic Surgery wards/Intensive Care Unit (ICU) or Cardiology wards/Coronary Care Unit (CCU). You will be required to perform shift work. The work schedule and hours will be discussed and planned with successful applicants based on mutual agreement, although we would need successful applicants to work at least 2 days per week.
Requirements:
Registered Nurse or Nursing qualification recognised by the Singapore Nursing Board with at least 1-2 years’ nursing experience in an acute hospital setting
Documented proof of:
(i) Measles (or Mumps, Measles and Rubella) vaccination or serological evidence of measles immunity; and
(ii) Diphtheria (Tetanus, Diphtheria and Pertussis) vaccination taken during preceding 10 years at prevailing point of reference as required for all healthcare workers under the Healthcare Services Act with effect from 3 January 2022. Applicants without these vaccinations are welcome to apply if they undertake to complete the vaccination(s) before work commencement upon successful interview and are offered employment
We regret that only applicants who have been fully vaccinated for Covid-19 (according to MOH’s definitions) will be considered due to exposure risk

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Recovery Nurse | Staff Nurse | SNB Registered | Orchard

Working days: 5.5 days, staggered hours 8 hours depending on the roster plan
Salary: $2500 - $3500
Location: Paragon Orchard

Duties of a Recovery Nurse
Recovery nurses provide critical care to patients before and after surgery. Recovery nurses treat a wide range of patients. They clean wounds, administer medication and monitor the progress of the patients' conditions
Before Surgery
Work with anesthesiologists, surgeons, and surgical nurses to prepare patients for surgery.
To record vital signs, instruct patients on the details of the procedures and administer intravenous therapy and medication.
Help doctors transfer patients to the operating room, and may be asked to clean wounds, sterilize equipment and make sure patients' rooms are ready for their arrival.
To communicate with loved ones and inform them of patients' conditions.
After Surgery
After surgery, recovery nurses are patients' primary care givers.
Monitor their vital signs, clean bandages and comfort patients when they wake up from anesthesia.
Administer tests, analyze lab results and report back to surgeons and doctors.
Track the progress of patients' conditions, and ensure patients receive adequate rest, food, fluids and nutrients.
Teach patients how to clean their bandages, take medication and care for themselves after they leave the hospital

title: Senior / Staff Nurse (Perioperative Nurse)* (JR801) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
You will be responsible to provide personalized, specialized and cost-effective care to the patients in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures, standards of nursing care, and practices.

Job Responsibilities
· Implements protective measures to prevent injury due to chemical, electrical, laser, mechanical, radiation, and thermal sources
· Transport the patient according to individual needs and evaluates for signs and symptoms of skin and tissue injury related to transfer or transport
· Determines the need for, prepares, applies, and remove devices designed to enhance operative exposure, prevent neuromuscular injury, maintain skin and tissue integrity, and maintain body alignment and optimal physiological functioning
· Uses supplies and equipment within safe parameters
· Performs required counts ensuring that patient is free from injury related to retained sponges, instruments, and sharps
· Evaluates for signs and symptoms of chemical, electrical, laser, physical, and radiation injury and injury to skin and tissue
· Contributes to minimizing operative time by anticipation and advanced preparation, working with team members to coordinate efforts to prioritize the patient’s care, and efficiently accomplishing tasks necessary to achieve a common goal
· Implement aseptic technique (e.g. crating and maintain a sterile field, applying basic methodologies to prevent contamination of open wounds, and isolating the operative site from the surrounding non-sterile physical environment)
· Initiates infection prevention activities
· Manages collection, handling, and disposition of culture and specimen
· Administer prescribed medications and solutions according to hospital policy

Requirements
· Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB)
· At least 2 years of Operating Theatre experience is highly preferred
· Diploma or Degree in Nursing from recognized training institutions approved by SNB
· Good interpersonal and communication skills
· Compassionate, positive and caring nature
· Prepared to work on 3 rotating shifts
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Infection Control Nurse Clinician (Bonuses, Allowances)
company_info: MTM Engage Pte. Ltd. provides recruitment and placement services to job seekers and employers, to assist them in obtaining the most ideal and fair employment or staffing. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is in the social services sector providing elder care services, and is looking for an Infection Control Nurse (ICN) Clinician.

Job Description:
As an ICN Clinician, you will be at the forefront of our infection prevention and control efforts.
Responsible for developing, implementing, and evaluating comprehensive infection control programs, policies, and procedures.
Playing a vital role in minimizing the risk of infections, promoting a healthy living environment, and safeguarding the well-being of our residents and staff.
Responsibilities:
Develop and implement infection prevention and control policies, protocols, and best practices in compliance with local regulatory guidelines and standards.
Conduct regular risk assessments and audits to identify potential infection control issues and recommend appropriate preventive measures.
Provide education and training to staff on infection control practices, including hand hygiene, proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE), and environmental cleaning.
Collaborate with healthcare professionals to investigate and manage outbreaks or infectious incidents within the nursing home.
Monitor infection control practices and compliance, conducting regular audits and inspections.
Stay updated on the latest developments in infection control guidelines and disseminate relevant information to staff.
Act as a resource and provide guidance to staff on infection control issues and concerns.
Collect and analyse data related to infections and outbreak patterns, identifying trends, and implementing interventions as needed.
Collaborate with the management team to develop and implement quality improvement initiatives related to infection control.
Participate in infection control committees and interdisciplinary meetings to contribute expertise and insights.
Anchor and coordinate all vaccinations and outbreak matter for our residents and both clinical and non-clinical staff.
Lead a team of ICLNs across our nursing homes to drive infection control related initiatives and more.
Any other adhoc duties relating to infection prevention & control assigned by the Head of Nursing.
Requirements:
Registered Nurse with a valid practicing license from the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB).
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in infection control, preferably in a healthcare or nursing home setting.
Other Information:
Mondays to Fridays, 8am - 515pm or 830am - 545pm
Bonuses

title: Nurse Clinician (Infection Control)* (JR 297) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job-holder assesses, implements and evaluates infection control practices by nursing staff. The job-holder is responsible for staff education and competency in infection control.
Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates infection control practices of nursing staff, doctors and all healthcare workers in AH
Conducts teaching for nursing, paramedical and medical staffs and students in infection control practices and guidelines
Coordinates and collaborates with other healthcare team members and service providers on infection control practices and guidelines
Conducts and evaluates audits on infection control practices
Reviews and develops infection control policies and procedures in consultation with nurse managers, doctors and Infection Control Committee
Compiles information on epidemiological organism and nosocomial infection data and initiates actions where necessary
Reviews, records and completes data for reporting to the National Infection Prevention Committee, Ministry of Health
Carries out investigations, conducts follow-ups during major outbreaks in the unit and / or hospital
Plans, implements and evaluates in service talks and training courses / activities based on infection control
Ensures patient care delivery follows established standards of care and infection control policies
Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
Prepares reports on infections and other related statistics required by AH, Medical Affairs (Quality Assurance) and / or MOH, and other departments upon requests
Secondary Responsibilities:
Acts as a resource person to nursing, medical, paramedics and administrative staff on issues relating to outbreaks and infection control issues. Reports to relevant hospital / medical administrators when required
Updates and maintains relevant infection control statistics
Participates / leads in quality improvement / research projects
Participates / leads in unit-based infection control team
Mentors newly appointed Nurse Clinicians
Follows up with accidental sharps / mucus membrane exposures to blood and body fluids
Informs and notifies wards and relevant staff / or government authority of patients with communicable disease
Assists in arranging prompt isolation of infected patients in co-operation with nursing managers / nursing staff
Updates and implements hospital infection control policy in consultation with Chairman and the Infection Prevention Committee
Conducts orientation programs for nursing staff and students
Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Senior Nurse Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse
Requirements:
Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Assistant Nurse Clinician
Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board, and certification / prior working experience for a year in infection control.
Technically skilled, competent and able to work independently
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Computer literacy skills –MS Word, MS Excel and PowerPoint

title: Nurse Educator* (JR 301) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The job-holder assesses, identifies, implements, co-ordinates and evaluates departmental nursing staffs’ continuing education, training and development plans to ensure provision of competent and quality patient care. They are responsible for nursing staff induction, clinical education / training, in-service education, personal and professional growth.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
Serves as resource person in education/nursing training matters and clinical issues to provide high quality standard of care
Plans and provides direct clinical supervision for nursing students and junior staff
Facilitates the clinical learning environment of nursing students to improve nursing students’ learning experiences
Monitors and evaluates nursing students’ feedback; develop action-plans collaboratively with ward nursing colleagues to improve nursing students’ learning experiences
Collaborates with education institution to ensure nursing students’ application of learning int- practice, e.g. hand hygiene compliance
Utilizes effective teaching strategies to develop critical thinking and clinical reasoning among nursing students, newly recruited nurses and nursing staff
Coaches preceptors and clinical instructor on their role effectiveness and assessment of nursing trainees and junior nurse’s performance e.g. formative and summative assessment, learning action plans
Conducts nursing staff orientation, training and continuing education programmes to maintain level of competency
Conducts learning needs analysis to identify learning gaps and training needs of nursing staff at ward/cluster level
Provides career counselling/coaching for all levels of nursing staffs’ professional development
Responsible to maintain and perform the following core competencies competently:
Clinical teaching / supervision
Structured teaching
Assessment of trainees and nurses’ clinical performance [formative & summative]
Reviews and revises existing curriculum following constructive recommendation on training/practice issues in order to meet the current educational needs of the hospital
Participates in the implementation and development of e-learning resources
Mentors and inducts potential acting nurse clinician for education track
Works collaboratively with ward/unit/cluster Nursing Officers and Senior Nursing Officers to [i] maintain clinical standards; [ii] conduct total performance management (includes career coaching and staff development) and [iii] assume joint managerial responsibilities, e.g. patient’s and / or family’s feedback, eHOR etc
Secondary Responsibilities:
Maintains clinical competency by seeking educational opportunities to maintain current knowledge and acquire new knowledge related to nursing practice
Collaborates with ward/cluster nursing leaders in nursing research initiatives/evidence-based practice to improve patient outcome
Participates in educational audit/quality improvement projects/risk management
Participates in nursing workgroup/committee at cluster/hospital level
Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Senior Nurse Educator, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse
Requirements
Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which a minimum of one (1) year experience in clinical teaching/professional development and continuing education at an acute hospital setting, and 2 years as Assistant Nurse Clinician
Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board. A teaching qualification would be an advantage Interest t- teach nursing training and development activities
Good interpersonal and communication skills

title: Assistant Nurse Clinician (Infection Control)* (JR 299) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The job-holder assesses, implements and evaluates infection control practices by nursing staff. The job-holder is responsible for staff education and competency in infection control.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
- Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates infection control practices of nursing staff, doctors and all healthcare workers in AH
- Conducts teaching for nursing, paramedical and medical staffs and students in infection control practices and guidelines
- Coordinates and collaborates with other healthcare team members and service providers on infection control practices and guidelines
- Participates and assist with audits on infection control practices
- Reviews and develops infection control policies and procedures in consultation with nurse managers, doctors and Infection Prevention Committee
- Compiles information on epidemiological organism and nosocomial infection data and assist with the initiation of actions where necessary
- Carries out investigations, conducts follow-ups during major outbreaks in the unit and / or hospital
- Plans, implements and evaluates in service talks and training courses / activities based on infection control policies
- Ensures patient care delivery follows established standards of care and infection control policies
- Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
- Assist to prepare reports on infections and other related statistics required by AH, Medical Affairs (Quality Assurance) and / or MOH, and other departments upon requests
Secondary Responsibilities:
- Acts as a resource person t- nursing, medical, paramedics and administrative staff on issues relating to outbreaks and infection control issues. Reports to relevant hospital / medical administrators when required
- Updates and maintains relevant infection control statistics
- Participates / leads in quality improvement / research projects
- Participates / leads in unit-based infection control team
- Follows up with accidental sharps / mucus membrane exposures to blood and body fluids
- Informs and notifies wards and relevant staff / or government authority of patients with communicable disease
- Assists in arranging prompt isolation of infected patients in co-operation with nursing managers / nursing staff
- Participates / conducts orientation programs for nursing staff and students
- Assumes additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Nurse Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse

Requirements
- Registered Nurse with at least 7 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Senior Staff Nurse I
- Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board, and certification / prior working experience for a year in infection control.
- Technically skilled, competent and able to work independently
- Good interpersonal and communication skills
- Computer literacy skills –MS Word, MS Excel and PowerPoint
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Staff Nurse
company_info: About the NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL The National University Hospital is a tertiary hospital and major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties, offering a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults. The Hospital was opened on 24 June 1985 as Singapore’s first restructured hospital. Each year, the Hospital attends to more than one million patients. As an academic health institution, patient safety and good clinical outcomes are the focus of the Hospital. It plays a key role in the training of doctors, nurses, allied health and other healthcare professionals. Translational research is pivotal in the Hospital’s three-pronged focus, and paves the way for new cures and treatment. A member of the National University Health System, it is the principal teaching hospital of the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and the NUS Faculty of Dentistry. For more information, visit www.nuh.com.sg

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
You will be responsible to provide personalized, specialised and cost-effective care to the patients in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
• Assesses patients’ needs on admission and on daily basis throughout their hospital stay
• Plans and implements care according to the assessed needs
• Evaluates and monitors patients’ progress according to planned care
• Documents care given and monitors outcomes on the established charts and forms
• Delivers safe and competent nursing care
• Participates actively in physicians’ rounds
• Carries out treatments and investigations as prescribed by physicians
• Collaborates and co-operates with physicians and other health-care providers in the smooth delivery of patient care and services
• Communicates and discusses patients’ progress and response to treatment with physicians, nursing and allied health colleagues involved in the patient care
• Provides patient/family with information and education on disease prevention, health education and rehabilitation techniques
• Ensures continuity of patient care and treatment plans through follow-ups
• Displays compassion, a positive and caring attitude towards patients

• Supervises and guides nursing students, new joiners, graduated registered nurses and junior staff in their work

• Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB)
• ICU/High Dependency ward experience preferred
• At least 2 years working experience in acute setting
• Diploma or Degree in Nursing from recognized training institutions approved by SNB
• Good interpersonal and communication skills
• Compassionate, positive and caring nature
• Possess good clinical skills and knowledge
• Prepared to work on 3 rotating shifts
• Entry level welcomed to apply

Inducts newly graduated advanced diploma nurses in specialty care of a specific group of patients

Reviews and develops practice policies and guidelines and nursing standards in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers and doctors
Assists with nursing audits on nursing care standards
Applies best evidence to practice
Participates in research activities
Undertakes quality improvement / research projects
Participates in training / quality improvement / research committees

title: Senior / Staff Nurse (NIC)- Permanent-Alexandra Road
company_info: RMA Consultants is a highly experienced Human Resource Outsourcing (HRO) service provider that excels in delivering strategic HR solutions and advisory to help strengthen human capital for business success. Firmly grounded in comprehending significant social trends and key industry knowledge, RMA is focus-driven in providing practical HR solutions in today’s competitive marketplace in sourcing for Cross-functional Executive Search, Staffing, Recruitment and other customized HR Consultancy services.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
You will be responsible to provide personalized, specialised and cost-effective care to the patients in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices.

Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
• Assesses patients’ needs on admission and on daily basis throughout their hospital stay
• Plans and implements care according to the assessed needs
• Evaluates and monitors patients’ progress according to planned care
• Documents care given and monitors outcomes on the established charts and forms
• Delivers safe and competent nursing care
• Participates actively in physicians’ rounds
• Carries out treatments and investigations as prescribed by physicians
• Collaborates and co-operates with physicians and other health-care providers in the smooth delivery of patient care and services
• Communicates and discusses patients’ progress and response to treatment with physicians, nursing and allied health
colleagues involved in the patient care
• Provides patient/family with information and education on disease prevention, health education and rehabilitation techniques
• Ensures continuity of patient care and treatment plans through follow-ups
• Displays compassion, a positive and caring attitude towards patients
• Adhere to proper use and care of equipment
• Maintains a clean and safe working environment
Secondary Responsibilities:
• Supervises and guides nursing students, new joiners, graduated registered nurses and junior staff in their work
• Participates in clinical and service quality activities
• Keeping abreast with current nursing and health care practices
• Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned by Nursing Management Team
Requirements
• Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB)
• Incumbent must be comfortable to work wekends and PH at times to support inpatient ward/taking case load when manpower needs arise, comfortable to work shift at times (AM and PM shifts) during probation and to take patient case when referred for Home Care
• Experience in Gerontology or inpatient ward
• At least 2 years working experience in acute setting
• Diploma or Degree in Nursing from recognized training institutions approved by SNB
• Prepared to work on 3 rotating shifts
• Entry level welcomed to apply
If you are interested, kindly send your resume (in MS Word format) to Aparna at aparna@rmagroup.com.sg and Mounika at mounika@rmagroup.com.sg stating your salary expectations & availability to take it forward.
All Curriculum Vitaes will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. By sending us your personal data, you are deemed to consent to RMA Consultants Pte Ltd and its affiliates collecting, using and disclosing your personal data for the purposes set out in our Data Protection Policy at http://bit.ly/3GHgskn and Privacy Policy at http://bit.ly/3W63rp7. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Nurse Manager, SANH (Aljunied)
company_info: St. Andrew's Mission Hospital (SAMH) first began as a free dispensary for poor local and migrant women and children in 1913. Today, SAMH operates St. Andrew's Community Hospital, St. Andrew’s Autism Centre, St. Andrew’s Mission Hospital Clinics, St. Andrew’s Nursing Homes at Buangkok, Henderson and Queenstown and St. Andrew’s Senior Care centres at Kampong Glam, Tampines, Henderson and Queenstown. St. John's-St. Margaret’s Nursing Home and Senior Care Centre at Dover Avenue will begin operations in 2021.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Nurse Manager at St Andrew's Nursing Home (Aljunied) in Singapore. The Nurse Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing the nursing staff, ensuring the highest standards of patient care and safety, as well as ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. The Nurse Manager will also work collaboratively with other healthcare professionals to develop and implement policies and procedures.
Key Responsibilities
Oversee the team of registered and enrolled nurses, nursing aides, healthcare assistants.
Responsible for compliance of all nursing standards as stipulated by Ministry of health (MOH) and Singapore Nursing Board (SNB).
Promote evidence-based practices or nursing care delivery.
Ensure written policies and procedures and work process are available and up to date to guide the nursing care delivery.
Ensure the smooth transition of residents from acute to chronic care and back to the community, where possible.
Direct care of the residents to ensure compliance to standards.
Ensure appropriate skills mix and adequate manpower resourcing for all shifts and types of services.
Facilitate staff development, skills and competency upgrading through various opportunities. These may include formal education, in-house training or approved online learning programmes.
Guide orientation/induction programmes and preceptorship for all new staff.
Support the DON in nursing home management.
Qualifications
Registered Nurse/Licensed Practical Nurse in Singapore
Valid nursing licensure with Singapore Nursing Board (SNB) and appropriate certifications
Bachelor's degree or diploma in nursing
Minimum of 5 years of nursing experience, with 2 years of management experience
Strong leadership, organizational and communication skills
Excellent understanding of nursing practices and procedures
Experience in geriatric care desirable
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Excellent problem-solving skills

title: Care Manager (Nurse)
company_info: The Tsao Foundation strives to help older persons realise opportunities in longevity by being a catalyst for constructive systemic and mindset change. This mission is undertaken through four synergistic core initiatives: Community for Successful Ageing (ComSA) takes a community-wide approach to forge an integrated system of comprehensive programmes and services with the aim to promote health and wellbeing over the life course, and to enable ageing in place. Hua Mei Centre for Successful Ageing which enables ageing-in-place by pioneering replicable, community-based, integrated health and psychosocial age care service models grounded in person-centred principles Hua Mei Training Academy, dedicated to capacity building in professional community-based age care, informal and family caregiving, as well as personal development and community action in successful ageing through providing practitioner-driven training, education and consultancy services International Longevity Centre Singapore which supports policy, practice, advocacy and community development through initiating high impact research and collaborative platforms in population ageing issues and related action Established in 1993, the Tsao Foundation is a Singapore-registered charity with IPCs (Institutions of a Public Character) and engaged in the global response to longevity.
job_category: Customer Service, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services, Social Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
To be responsible as the Care Manager to assess, facilitate and advocate for the clients’ interest, to meet operational targets of the Foundation and the funding authorities.
Key Responsibilities
Determine suitability of client referrals as a team through initial screening in accordance with Foundation guidelines and requirements of funding bodies
Conduct full assessment, as a component of team assessment in the areas of medical, nursing, social, financial and psychological etc and ensure assessments are carried out as required
Identify problems related to illness and decline in functional, cognitive abilities and advocate early medical attention for client through appropriate intervention or referral
Facilitate the use of internal and external resources through appropriate linking of services to serve the basic support needs of the clients and families
Develop comprehensive client care plans and carry out regular evaluation, ensuring recommended services are in place to meet the needs of the clients, families and caregivers
Provide health education to the clients and families to reduce medical complication and accident prevention, and monitor medication management and compliance, nutrition, diet etc.
Participate in regular client review discussions with team members to evaluate efficacy and currency of care plans, and recommend modification as needed
Liaise with external agencies from government, social services and medical establishments to establish an effective network of care for the continuing care of the clients, particularly in respect of a good hospital discharge plan
Conduct termination reviews when required and write the relevant reports and referrals to facilitate the clients’ discharge to another service
Ensure CM activities meet regulatory requirements, and ensure accurate and timely documentation and submissions of client reports
Participate in continuous quality improvement projects
Represent the Foundation in presentation to external parties such as students on clinical attachments
Participate and lead where appropriate, in activities or outreach projects - internal or joint, that promote the Foundation’s cause and mission
Key Requirements
Singapore Nursing Board registered Nurse with minimum 3 years working experience
Professional certification / specialist diploma / advance diploma on gerontological nursing is preferred
Courses on care management is preferred
Working experience in case management / care coordination will be an added advantage
Excellent clinical knowledge and skill
Good communication skills in both spoken and written English
Penchant for working with older people
Able to communicate in local dialects
IT proficient
Salary listed is indicative and will commensurate with experience and qualification.
We sincerely regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The Assistant Nurse Manager will also be responsible for providing assistance and support to the Nurse Manager in the day-to-day operations, improvements and enhancements of clinical nursing services within the nursing home so as to ensure safe, high quality, efficient and cost-effective care is delivered to residents and their families.

Job Responsibilities
• Organise and provide on-the-job training to all staff to ensure there is continual development in the clinical aspects
• Manage and facilitate project teams to keep up-to-date on current trends
• Facilitate and guide staff in establishment and management of relationships with residents and their families and coordinate the administration of care plan between the parties involved
• Guide and teach the nurses on the process and steps to manage incident reporting activities including investigation, report writing and communicating response to the family members involved
• Provide advice and guidance to nurses on the management of complaints and enquiries lodged by residents and their families

Clinical Standards
• Responsible for the compliance of all nursing standards as stipulated by Ministry of Health and Singapore Nursing Board
• Leads quality assurance activities to monitor and evaluate the quality and appropriateness of nursing care
• Ensure quality audits are planned and conducted periodically. Follow up with areas for corrective improvements
• Promotes evidence-based practices or nursing care delivery
• Ensure written policies and procedures and work process are available and up to date to guide the nursing care delivery
• Ensure competency evaluation and conducting in-house training to impart clinical knowledge to less experienced nursing staff

Others
• Organise and facilitate projects and/or research on current issues and trends in the healthcare sector (e.g. infection control)
• Support the Nurse Manager in nursing home management and deputizes in his/her absence

Job Requirements
• Degree or Advance Diploma or Diploma in Nursing
• State Registered Nurse and valid practicing licensed issued by the Singapore Nursing Board
• Valid certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS)
• 5-6 years of clinical experience out of which 2-3 years must be in the management of chronic patients or 2-3 years as a Senior Staff Nurse
• Possess initiative, drive and self-motivation to persevere and make things happen
• Able to work effectively with diverse teams and all levels of employees to achieve positive outcomes
• High tolerance of stress and ambiguity
• People & Customer Centered

Other info
· Location: Toa Payoh
· Salary: $4000 to $5500
· Nursing home
· 5-day work, rotating morning/noon shift

(Interested candidates, pls apply with resume in MS Word format)

title: Registered Nurse & Enrolled Nurse
company_info: Your Health Comes First Welcome to PanCare Medical Clinic. Our team is dedicated to providing patients with comprehensive services to benefit their health and well-being. With our streamlined registration system and responsive diagnosis procedure, we have more time to focus on helping patients find treatments to feel better, and connecting them with resources to help them stay that way. Primary Care Ranging from acute illnesses to chronic diseases, our team is dedicated to be your partner in providing well-rounded care for you and your family. Health Screening PanCare provides a wide range of health screening services personalized for each individual. Vaccinations and Travel Medicine We get you ready for your travel plans, caring for you so that you can enjoy yourself with a peace of mind. Eye Screening Eye screening services are available for all patients from young to old. Skin and Hair Eczema, acne, hair loss or other skin problems? PanCare will be able to help. Minor Surgery PanCare can also help you with your ingrown toe nails, viral warts, stitches for wounds or other minor surgeries.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PanCare Medical proudly introduces its forthcoming Transitional Care Facility in Jurong East, catering to stable patients awaiting nursing home placement. Our central goal is to establish a nurturing temporary sanctuary for the elderly, fostering a sense of belonging and respect.

Our commitment extends to our devoted staff's well-being. We ensure optimal staffing and manageable workloads, prioritizing work-life equilibrium. Our vision is to cultivate a compassionate environment, empowering nurses and healthcare assistants to provide exceptional care to this esteemed population.

At our core, we offer a meticulously tailored program for seniors, guided by geriatricians, therapists, and social workers. We're equally dedicated to fostering strong family connections during this pivotal life phase. Join us in a role that exudes purpose and significance.

Position: Senior Registered Nurse, Registered Nurse, Enrolled Nurse
Location: West
Type: Full-time, Permanent
Shift: Rotating (2-shifts)

Responsibilities:
Deliver client care, including addressing medical emergencies, managing medications, and ensuring adherence to nursing protocols and safety regulations
Maintain accurate client medical records and schedules for medical follow-ups
Monitor patient conditions and report any changes to the medical team.
Collaborate with physicians, colleagues, and support staff to ensure comprehensive patient care.
Job Requirements and Qualifications:

Company Description
Yap & Ang Surgical Associates - Specialist Clinic comprising General Surgeon (Breast Surgery) and Plastic Surgeon (Reconstructive Surgery).

Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Registered Nurse preferably with an Advanced Diploma in Peri-operative Nursing at Yap & Ang Surgical Associates in Singapore.
The Registered Nurse will be responsible for coordinating and providing overall care for patients in an outpatient specialist clinic which includes consultations, minor surgical procedures, post-operative care, and assisting in operating theatre for major surgical procedures.

The Registered Nurse will need to chaperone the male surgeon for female patients, who make up the majority of patients in this practice.

title: Enrolled Nurse
company_info: Woodlands Health Campus (WHC) broke ground on 18 April 2017. The 1,800-bedded facility will comprise a fully-integrated Acute and Community Hospital, Specialist Outpatient Clinics and an Intermediate & Long-Term Care facility. Our vision for the single-build Campus will have both acute and community hospitals sharing the same building and medical teams. This will allow patients to move seamlessly from acute to rehabilitative care, with a unified care team. Our 'future-ready' Campus will employ practical technology to augment manpower needs to deliver care that is safe and more effective. Data analytics, telehealth, automation of manual processes or logistics robots are just some of the potential solutions WHC will use. We are already serving patients in our pre-operations wards located at the Yishun Health campus. Be part of a team providing person-centric, quality care to improve the lives of our patients, community and healthcare family. Similarly, our work in the community has already begun. Since 2015, we have been working with community care providers to create an ecosystem of support for some 600,000 residents in the North of Singapore. We work closely with stakeholders including schools, Voluntary Welfare Organisations, and social and primary care providers to develop initiatives on health promotion, education and engagement.

job_category: Environment / Health, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is one of the day care Surgery Centre. Currently it is seeking a Recovery Nurse to join its team.Recovery nurses provide critical care to patients before and after surgery. Recovery nurses treat a wide range of patients. They clean wounds, administer medication and monitor the progress of the patients' conditions

Before Surgery
Work with anesthesiologists, surgeons, and surgical nurses to prepare patients for surgery.
To record vital signs, instruct patients on the details of the procedures and administer intravenous therapy and medication.
Help doctors transfer patients to the operating room, and may be asked to clean wounds, sterilize equipment and make sure patients' rooms are ready for their arrival.

After Surgery

Monitor their vital signs, clean bandages and comfort patients when they wake up from anesthesia.
Administer tests, analyze lab results and report back to surgeons and doctors.
Track the progress of patients' conditions, and ensure patients receive adequate rest, food, fluids and nutrients.
Teach patients how to clean their bandages, take medication and care for themselves after they leave the hospital
Requirements
Possess Diploma/Degree in Nursing from a recognised institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board
SNB registered Nurse
At least 2 years relevant experience in healthcare operating theatre settings
Able to thrive in fast-paced environment
Proactive and supportive in carrying out new initiatives
Able to commit to staggered shift hours; working Mon -Fri 7am - 7pm (8 hours Rotating Shift) and alternate Saturday 8:30am - 1pm. Sunday and Public Holiday is a day off
Interested applicants please send your resume to recruit1@tbs.com.sg. We thank you for your application but only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

optimal delivery of required care to the clients.

Comply with approved Nursing SOPs.
Work with multidisciplinary team to analyze and evaluate nursing care plan and ensure care plan is implemented by team.
Identify symptoms of clients related to illness or decline in functional/cognitive abilities and advocate early attention.
Mentor and guide, NAs and HCAs in performing their functional duties.
Administer medications and treatments as prescribed.
Assist client to manage common age-related conditions such as incontinence and loss of mobility.
Assist Registered Nurse as when required.
Other additional operational duties as assigned by Centre Manager.
Qualifications & Skills Required
Nitec in Nursing
Registered with SNB
Experience working in an elderly setting is an advantage
Compassion, critical thinking, and organizational skills

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Staff Nurse / Scrub Nurse (OT & Clinical)
Location: Orchard Paragon

Working Hours:
Mon – Fri : 8.30am to 5.30pm
Sat: 8.30am to 1.30pm (According to doctor’s opening hours. If doctor closes clinic on Sat then no need to work)
Job Summary
Provide clinic patient care.
Assist clinic administration, patient consultation and clinical procedures.
Roles and Responsibilities
Patient Care Management (OT)
Perform check and prepare operating room readily for procedure.
Respect and protect patients’ right and confidentiality.
Assess patient pre operatively and complete patient safety check prior to procedure.
Check and ensure full preparation of set, suture, supplementary possible use of supplies prior to surgery.
Assist patient’s positioning for procedure.
Assist surgeon and anticipate surgeon needs during surgeries.
Assist in anesthesia, recovery, circulating duties and any other duties within the team.
Coordinate with surgeon or anesthetist to ensure smooth running of surgery list.
Collect and prepare specimens for laboratory analysis where necessary.
Provide guidance for new or junior staff to ensure quality-nursing care is rendered.
Implement and maintain the principles of sterility and asepsis for all procedures and techniques.
Comply with established guidelines of infection control practices.
Recognize and intervene in emergency situation involving patient care or other team members.
Document accurately and legibly in relevant patient care records and in billing of consumables and implants
Patient Care Management (Clinical)
Perform patient assessment undergoing procedures
Provide psychological support and comfort to the patient
Prepare supplies and medications required
Assist radiologist or radiographer in ultrasound and mammography procedures
Monitor the patient throughout the procedure
Recovery and discharge of patient according to discharge criteria
Replenish stocks when necessary
Maintain cleanliness of the environment and care of equipment in patient care areas
Perform any other duties as assigned
Job Requirements
Registered Nurse with Singapore Nursing Board
Degree or Diploma in Nursing from a recognized institution
Nurses with prior working experience in clinical settings will be an advantage

Interested applicants may choose to apply / Contact me your updated resume for our consultant to find you a suitable oppurtunities

title: Clinical Nursing Specialist / Up to 5.5K + Allowance + Incentives / #Urgent
company_info: Meet Integrity. Recruitment experts in Life Sciences and we've helped recruit the most prized talent in Pharmaceutical, Medical Device and Biotechnology. With 40% of our waking time dedicated to work, we know the importance of how smallest actions can create the biggest impact in people’s lives. To discover more about how we can help you with your recruiting needs or your career, connect with us.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview:

An esteemed Medical Device company is looking for a Clinical Nurse Specialist to join their dynamic team. This role is cross-functional, working with multiple stakeholders, and fast-paced. Perfect for energetic individuals.

The main objective of this role is to provide technical and clinical support to surgeons using the company’s instruments, implants and consumables.

You will be responsible for:
Assisting surgeons in performing surgical techniques in the field of sports medicine using the company’s instruments, implants and consumables
Guiding surgeons in using new products and techniques
Ensuring appropriate instruments and implants are at the hospital and complete before each use
Building positive relationships with customers
Identifying customer needs and recommending appropriate products to address them
Maintaining a thorough understanding of the company’s product lines; updates, features, benefits, surgical techniques
Adhering to compliance policy and guidelines at all times
You should have the following qualities:
Be a Registered nurse
Possess a Degree in medicine or medical qualification
Possess 3+ years related working experience
Professional experience in the sports medicine field is advantageous
An understanding of anatomy, pathophysiology, conditions and biomechanics that relates to orthopedics and sports medicine
Proactive, well structured and independent working style
High sense of responsibility and reliability
Excellent team player
Confident and competent appearance
Assertive
Good English communication skills – verbal and written
Highly customer orientated
Proven ability to problem solve
Organization skills and ability to work under pressure
Must be able to work after office hours and weekends when needed

company: ACTIVE GLOBAL RESPITE CARE PTE. LTD.
company_info: Active Global Home & Community Care is a provider of holistic, professional and affordable eldercare services. Started in 2012 by providing live-in caregivers for elderly with complex medical conditions such as dementia, stroke etc., it has extended to subsidised home care services such as home personal care, home medical, home therapy, home nursing etc. Appointed by the Ministry of Health in 2018, it also operates two active ageing hubs. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
• Provide nursing and basic care to clients.
• Evaluate and monitor the progress of clients’ treatment regularly. • Bedside nursing duties (permanent shift / rotating shift/office hours) such as: o Assistance with ADLs, lifting and transferring of patients where needed.
o Provide comfort care o Keeping pre-cooked meals to the patients, o Assist with activities appropriate to the patient’s abilities
o Vital signs monitoring
o Male and female catheterization
o Wound management, removal of stitches
o Tracheostomy care and management
o Nasogastric tube insertion and care management
o Medication management:
➢ Drug calculation/reconstitution, manage storage and administration of meds (inclusive of controlled drugs)
➢ Medication packing • Ensure strict compliance with clinical regulations as a nurse.
• Create and maintain a database of all clients, ensuring strict compliance with documentation, and providing evidence-based treatment with accurate and timely records.
• Ensure appropriate, legible, and prompt documentation when required.
• Any other ad hoc tasks assigned by the management.

Requirements:
• Minimum Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in nursing (RN)
• Must be a Registered Nurse with Singapore Nursing Board with a clean disciplinary record (nurses on conditional license may not apply for this role).
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office and comfortable with IT would be ideal.
• Some weekends, public holidays, and overnight shift may be required depending on client needs.

Benefits:
• Attractive base salary for driving results.
• Great opportunity for career development in a growing market and organization.
• Industry-specific training and coaching by a highly experienced team.
• Highly flexible environment to brainstorm and implement ideas on improvements.
• 15 days annual leave.

title: NURSE
company_info: In 1992, Rainbow Centre Singapore was established as a registered charity with the Registry of Societies and subsequently, it was granted the Institutions of a Public Character (IPC) status under the Charities Act. The Centre runs 3 Special Education (SPED) schools and 2 Early Intervention Programme (EIP) centres at Margaret Drive campus and Yishun Park Campus for children with special needs. All the Centre's programmes adopt a holistic developmental curriculum in the areas of language and communication skills, cognitive skills, social and emotional skills, fine and gross motor skills, and adaptive daily living skills. They are carried out by a multi-disciplinary team of trained SPED and EIP Teachers, Speech Language Therapists, Physiotherapists, Occupational Therapists, Psychologists, Social Workers, and Music and Art Therapists.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Nurse with Rainbow Centre, you will join our team of dedicated professionals in our Admiral Hill campus. You will be responsible for providing basic medical care and nursing support to students aged 2-18.
The responsibilities of the Nurse includes:
Management of health screening of our students, including liaising with the School Health Unit, IOH, and volunteer doctors, planning and scheduling, submission of documents and follow-up on review cases.
Clinic management, which includes renewing the clinic licence, carrying out necessary inspection of the equipment, maintaining the cleanliness of the sick bay and upkeeping the supplies whenever necessary.
Rendering first aid to children, caregivers and staff both within campus and during semesteral outings
Providing First Aid training and consultation services to stakeholders.
Accompanying students to the doctor in the event of an accident or child needing medical attention when attending session in schools, and to follow-up on doctor’s visits with accident/other reports.
Collation and maintenance of students’ medical records, including medication and allergies.
Performs any other duties as assigned by the Principals/Executive Director.
Requirements:
A registered nurse with Singapore Nursing Board
Previous experience in a school or SSA setting will be an added advantage
Basic knowledge in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills

title: STAFF NURSE (Taman Jurong)
company_info: Singapore Anglican Community Services is the community service arm of the Diocese of Singapore. It is a major psychiatric rehabilitation service provider in Singapore. It also offers care services for families-in-crisis and seniors to age-in-place. SACS's goal is to minister to those who are under-served and disadvantaged and to help them restore dignity, health and well-being, so that they have the opportunity to live life to its fullest potential.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
St Andrew's Nursing Home (Taman Jurong)
An established 290-bed facility at Taman Jurong, we seek to provide long-term support, care and rehabilitation to the under-served and disadvantaged of the community at large, regardless of race or religion.
Job Responsibilities
Work closely with the resident’s doctor and multi-disciplinary team to provide care to the residents; updates on changes in the residents’ condition and needs.
Ensure care delivery and nursing interventions as outlined in the care plan.
Work with allied health professionals and/or initiate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures.
Carry out and supervise assessments of all new admissions.
Prepare clinical documentation and ensure all documentations are current.
Prepare and administer medications to residents and comply with safe medication practices.
Supervise staff to ensure safe medication practice.
Participate in training and development of staff.
Work with Supervisor to conduct quality assurance activities to monitor and evaluate the quality and appropriateness of nursing care.
Deal with emergency that arises and ensure prompt actions to mitigate the situation. Escalate promptly to supervisor, where necessary.
Job Requirements
Minimum Diploma/Advanced Diploma/Degree in Nursing.
Minimum 2 years’ experience as a Registered Nurse with at least 1 year relevant working experience is preferred.
Ability to work both independently and within a multi-disciplinary team.
Proficiency in MS Office applications e.g. Word, Excel, Power Point.
Knowledge in Nhelp Account and Timesoft will be advantage.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
Teamwork and passion for serving the elderly patients.
Able to work cohesively with colleagues from all disciplines
Able to work 3 rotating shifts including weekend duties and public holidays (for in-patient wards)
PROFESSIONAL LICENCE
Must be Registered Nurse with Singapore Nursing Board (SNB)
Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) certified
All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting

title: Staff Nurse (Home Care Services)
company_info: Yong-en Care Centre was registered as a charitable organization with the Registry of Societies in 1996, with IPC status. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking suitable candidates with the heart and the resilience to serve in the home health services team.
Job Responsibilities
Plan and facilitate home health services for clients
Develop and implement patient-centred care plan to home care clients
Perform evidence-based nursing interventions according to client’s care plan such as monitoring of vitals, medication management, wound care management, handle feeding tube, urinary catheter and other procedures
Perform basic health screening of client and make referrals as necessary
Monitor for early signs and/or deterioration of client’s conditions with appropriate physiological assessments and observations
Practise safety and infection control precautionary measures
Maintain timely and accurate documentation of clients’ progress and collation of data
Coordinate with other care disciplines for care integration and transition
Engage clients and caregivers in education and management of health conditions
Participate in medical emergencies or crisis situations as appropriate
Manage and monitor medical supplies, equipment and consumables inventory
Liaise with Community Relations department in management of volunteers, facilitation and coordination of CIP from schools / corporate groups, development and maintenance of corporate partnerships
Prepare monthly data report
Any other relevant/appropriate duties as assigned

Registered Nurse with a Diploma/ Degree in Nursing
Minimum 3 years of relevant nursing experience
Competent to independently provide nursing care according to protocols established
High integrity, resilient, passionate about nursing and helping others
Effective communications and interpersonal skills and able to communicate in dialects with non-English/Mandarin speaking clients
Strong team player, resourceful and systematic
5-day work week to be scheduled according to operational needs. Working hours could be either 8.00am-5.00pm/ 8.30am-5.30pm/ 9am-6pm

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Senior Staff Nurse, Central Sterile Supplies Department
company: NATIONAL DENTAL CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
company_info: NATIONAL DENTAL CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. National Dental Centre Singapore (NDCS) is the largest specialty referral centre for oral healthcare. It comprises of multi-disciplinary teams, leads in the training of dental professionals in Singapore and support advancements in dentistry research.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with Nurse Clinician and Senior Nurse Manager to define and develop plans to meet objectives for excellent care and best outcome for patients
Ensure work carried out is according to hospital guidelines, policies, procedures and work instructions.
Assume responsibility and accountability for the safe operation of all processes.
Develop, implement and collaborate with all staff to ensure a safe and comfortable environment for all staff to work.
Ensure and maintain principles of sterility of all instruments before, during and after distribution.
Ensure proper documentation of processes and upkeep records promptly and maintain accurate inventory of instrument sets.
Ensure equipment is at its functional state and safe for use before distribution.
Be knowledgeable in the functions and usage, care and maintenance of equipment and instrumentation.
Proficient and knowledgeable of the various sterilization methods and complex instruments.
Plan, co-ordinate and ensure availability of instrumentation, equipment and supplies when requested by user areas.
Ensure and supervise all staff so that all Biological Culture are properly handled, correctly labelled, incubated and documented
Ensure that all documentation of sterilization process is properly and accurately entered.
Ensure that all staff practice Standard Precaution and put on full PPE at all times.
Ensure and maintain safe work place for all staff to prevent accidents and injuries.
Ensure all equipment is in good working order.
Assist SNM/NC on collection of quality indicators and provide information for quality reports
Responsible for supervising subordinates in following established guidelines in their assembling and packing of instrument.
Check and ensure that all sealing and culture monitoring equipment are in good working condition.
Ensure and maintain safe work place for all staff to prevent accidents and injuries.
Verify all sterilization process printouts when required.
Assist the Nurse Clinician in performance appraisal and continuous assessment of new staff
Assist the Nurse Clinician to maintain / update records of skill development / competency check lists of new / trainees of discipline.
Update and maintain proper documentation for all changes and entries of instrument stock inventory.
Ensure all instrument requests are met in a timely manner.
Assist in inventory and stock take
Supervise and guide the Healthcare Attendants and Healthcare Assistants in the pasting of service code for processed goods.
Participate in quality improvement activities, self-development and personal growth programmes.
EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE
A recognized Certificate/ Degree in nursing or its equivalent.
At least 5 years as a Registered Nurse in health care setting.
Valid BCLS Certification.
Valid practising certificate issued by Singapore Nursing Board.

title: Registered Nurse (Home Care)
company_info: Founded in 1976, HNF is the largest and most established home healthcare service provider in Singapore. It is also the only provider that operates islandwide in Singapore. HNF delivers comprehensive care programmes that are dedicated to our patients, regardless of their income level. From nursing to medical care, to looking after patients’ social well-being and other practical daily needs, we bring care and support into the homes of those in need. Home is the best place to recover from or cope with an ailment. At HNF, we embrace our patients with all-round support they can depend on. We start by understanding our patients’ needs and by adopting a multidisciplinary case management approach. With our nursing, medical and network of partners, our holistic patient-centric home healthcare plans are individually tailored to meet the needs of each patient. Quality patient care is paramount in our daily operations. We work towards improving the quality of life of our patients with their best interests at heart.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
Provide Home Based Nursing Services
Conduct Caregiver training
Perform biopsychosocial and environmental assessments to identify strengths and needs of clients, families and/or caregivers.
Plan, develop and evaluate person-centred nursing care plans with considerations of client’s needs and preference. Communicate care plans and address the concerns from patient and family.
Implement and evaluate care interventions(s) e.g. wound care, medication management, continence care,; ensuring at all times:
Practice safety and infection control precautionary measures.
Manage patient workload through timely planning and scheduling based on the client’s needs. Utilise workforce optimiser to actualise the planned visits.
Build therapeutic relationships and empower the clients, families and/or caregivers for self- management through health promotion, caregivers training and motivational techniques.
Coordinate with multidisciplinary team for care integration and transition
Initiate emergency protocols when necessary.
Discuss / escalate to Supervisor and/or Care team on any problems encountered in patient’s condition and/or in the handling of patients and/or care-givers/family members.
Develop discharge plan and refer patients to other service provider to transit care.
Supervise the work of the Enrolled Nurses in his/her zone, as well as nursing students on clinical attachment to achieve their learning objectives.
Perform visits during Emergency Nursing Services for normal and extended hours.
Maintain timely and accurate documentation of patients’ condition and care given.
Collect correct fees by checking the subsidized status of patients, issue receipt and submit the collection in a timely and accurate manner.
Facilitate application of healthcare financial scheme such as Senior Mobility Funds when appropriate.
Exercise appropriate use of resources and supplies.
Comply with guidelines and policies to ensure client confidentiality and personal data protection.
Keep abreast of new technology and nursing knowledge through reflection on practice and continuous professional development.
Support quality audit to maintain and improve standards of care.
Assist the (Senior) Nurse Manager and/or Nurse Clinician to improve, facilitate and implement changes within the home nursing work processes.
Assist in committee/workgroup activities as directed by (Senior) Nurse Manager and/or Nurse Clinician

title: Nurse Counsellor
company_info: NORTHEAST HEALTH INTERNATIONAL PTE. LTD. Established in 1999, Northeast Medical Group (NEMG) is a dynamic medical group with a social mission. Our main long-term interest is in developing a sustainable primary care landscape in Singapore. NEMG’s strengths include providing general medical and surgical services within the community.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Title: Nurse Counsellor
Responsibility:
· Provide Nurse Counselling to United Primary Care Network (PCN) patients which includes education on Chronic Disease Management, Smoking Cessation, Mental Health, and health promotion.
· Conduct Diabetic Foot Screening, Foot Care education and Diabetic Eye Screening.
· Escalate cases to the doctors based on PCN escalation protocol. Raise “priority risk” cases for case discussion with the doctors.
· Educate patients on the use of medical devices such as blood pressure monitors, blood glucometers, inhalers.
· Track, document and review patient’s progress in chronic disease management and lifestyle changes. This can involve telephone consultations and telehealth monitoring.
· Identify patients with poorly controlled clinical indicators for closer management and monitoring. Work with individual patients to develop or tailor individual health plans and to revise and change health plans according to needs. Deliver direct patient care as needed according to established standards and protocols.
· Work closely with the Primary Care Coordinators (PCCs) in care coordination and care transition. This will involve liaising with the Public Institutions, Clinic Doctors and Clinic Assistants, Community Health, and Social Providers.
· Provide inputs on clinical results to the various clinics in the network.
· Review or revise nursing guidelines, standards and procedures related to Chronic Disease Management.
· Comply with universal precautions and adhere to all infection control practices in the delivery of nursing care.
· Always maintain confidentiality of patient medical records.
· Participate in continuing nursing education to maintain currency of practice and contribute to PCN quality improvement to enhance care standards and patient outcomes.
· Perform any other adhoc duties assigned by the Head of PCN.
Job requirements:
· Registered nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board.
· Currently practicing as a nurse or case manager.
· At least 5 years of clinical nursing experience as a staff nurse in hospital and/or primary care.
· Advanced Diploma in Nursing with specialisation in Chronic Disease management.
· Able to travel around from clinic to clinic.
· Able to speak Mandarin and Dialect is preferred as clinics are handling elderly patients.
· Nurses dealing with dialysis as chronic disease will also be considered.

• Supervision of EN, NA and HA/HCA in their daily duties.
• Reinforce compliance and familiarisation with SOP and ENHS.

title: Staff Nurse
company_info: Company Overview Ren Ci Hospital is an established Voluntary Welfare Organization (VWO) in rehabilitative and geriatric care, primarily serving the elderly community in Singapore. Ren Ci (??) means loving kindness and compassion which became the guiding principles in our delivery of affordable medical, nursing and rehabilitative care services, serving all regardless of background, race and religion. Our spectrum of care includes a community hospital, a chronic sick unit, two nursing homes and three day centres offering day rehab, day care and centre-based nursing services. Over the years, Ren Ci has evolved and expanded its services to meet the needs of a rapidly ageing population in Singapore, leverage on partnerships and engagement with the community to give dignity back to the elderly. As a dynamic healthcare organisation, we are looking for suitable professionals who have a passion for serving the elderly and who wish to build a career in the community care sector.

title: Nurse Manager
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:

· Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care of patients with complex healthcare needs according to updated standards of nursing practice.
· Ensures patient care delivery (inclusive of education and counselling) is carried out according to established standards of care practice using patient care plan / clinical pathways.
· Co-ordinates patients’ access and treatment sequence where required for the specialty.
· Conducts teaching and counselling for patients and their families / carers.
· Initiates and ensures implementation of discharge planning for patients.
· Leads and participates actively in the review of patients with the multidisciplinary team.
· Follows up on patients at NUH specialist outpatient clinics where appropriate.
· Conducts specialty nurse-led clinic for patients and their families where needed.
· Provides clinical supervision to nurses and nurse trainees to ensure quality patient care delivery.
· Updates and maintains patient consultation / training statistics / other types of register / registry where appropriate.
· Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care.

Secondary Responsibilities:
· Acts as a resource person for clinical nursing matters
· Plans, implements, and evaluates in-service staff education and specialty training courses based on unit and individual training needs.
· Inducts newly graduated advanced diploma nurses in specialty care of a specific group of patients.
· Guides and develops specialty competencies of registered nurses.
· Reviews and develops clinical pathways and / or other plans of care in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers, doctors, and paramedical staff.
· Reviews and develops practice policies and guidelines and nursing standards in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers and doctors.
· Assists with nursing audits on nursing care standards.
· Applies best evidence to practice.
· Participates in research activities.
· Undertakes quality improvement / research projects.
· Participates in training / quality improvement / research committees.
· Contributes to performance appraisals of enrolled nurses, senior enrolled nurses, staff nurses, senior staff nurses and advanced diploma nursing students.
· Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse

Requirements
· Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification or Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board.
· SNB Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Assistant Nurse Clinician
· Valid BCLS
· Computer literacy skill – MS Word and PowerPoint

title: Nurse
company_info: BIG - FOOT LOGISTIC PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We would like to hire Full-time and part-time Locum nurses for our ground ambulances.

1. Qualification:
A nurse registered with the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB) as a registered nurse with a minimum of 5 years experience in Emergency Medicine, Intensive Care, General Survey, Anaesthesia, or any other discipline that manages acute and critical patients, preferably with relevant post-graduate qualifications, with a valid practicing certificate or Current existing clinical Governing officer (ICU Staff nurse ) of ambulance service providers and with at least 5 years experience in patient transport and good standing

2. Basic Skills and Competencies:
- Strong communication skills to effectively interact with patients, families, and other healthcare
professionals.
- Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities to make sound clinical judgments and decisions.
- Empathy and compassion to provide patient-centered care and support.
- Attention to detail and strong organizational skills to maintain accurate patient records and
manage multiple tasks efficiently.
- Physical stamina and the ability to handle the demands of the nursing profession, standing for
extended periods and lifting or assisting patients.
Scope of duty:
a. Transport and transfer patients from hospital to hospital as and when required.
b. Carrying out duties at events as medic nurses if required.
c. Transferring of wheelchair patient if required.
d. The CGO must develop, establish, implement, and endorse clinical protocols adopted by the
medical transport.
e. As CGO should develop protocols for specific emergency conditions in the event
they are encountered at the pick-up or e-route.
f. Modes of communication to request further assistance or support should be made available
for the EMTs.
g. To ensure keep medical equipment and Trauma bag items up to date.

3. Clinical Knowledge and Skills:

4. Nurses need a solid foundation of clinical knowledge and skills to provide safe and effective care. This includes understanding human anatomy and physiology, disease processes, pharmacology, medical-surgical nursing, obstetric and gynaecological nursing, psychiatric nursing, and other relevant areas depending on their specialization.

Salary – will be discussed during the interview.
