title: School Nurse [Dover Campus]
company: UNITED WORLD COLLEGE OF SOUTH EAST ASIA
company_info: UWC South East Asia (UWCSEA) is a K–12 international school offering a holistic, values-based education. One of 18 UWC schools and colleges around the world, UWCSEA embraces the shared mission to make education a force to unite people, nations and cultures for peace and a sustainable future. Both campuses in Singapore are IB World Schools, offering UWCSEA's mission-aligned concept-based curriculum to 5,500 students aged 4-18. The UWCSEA-developed learning programme develops the skills and qualities that our students will need to be independent learners and global citizens. From Kindergarten through Grade 12, students participate fully in the five elements of the UWCSEA learning programme: Academics, Activities, Outdoor Education, Personal and Social Education and Service. In Primary School (ages 4–11) and Middle School (ages 11–14) students are immersed in our learning programme which prepares students for independent learning regardless of their educational background. In Grades 9 and 10 (ages 14–16), students complete two-year GCSE certificates within the framework of our learning programme, while students who enter the College in Grade 10 enrol in our successful one-year Foundation IB course. In Grades 11 and 12 (ages 16–18), students complete the internationally-recognised two-year IB Diploma Programme.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
All applications must be submitted through our portal to be considered for the role. Please visit the career page on our portal for the full job details.

UWCSEA is looking for full-time School Nurse at its Dover Campus from September 2023 on the following shift(s):
7:15am to 4:15pm
09:00am to 6:00pm
11:00am to 8:00pm
Note: The successful incumbent will be required to work on rotating shift based on the duty roster, Mondays to Fridays.
Main Responsibilities
Reporting to the Head Nurse, the incumbent’s role is to facilitate positive student responses to normal development; promote health and safety; intervene with actual and potential health problems; provide case management services, and actively collaborate with others to promote student and family capacity for adaptation, self-management, self-advocacy and learning.
Person Specifications
State Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board.
Minimum 2 years in Nursing, 1 year of relevant experience will be an advantage.
Excellent English (written and spoken) and computer literacy.
Experience with child protection and safeguarding an advantage.
A committed interest in working with school aged children, young people and their families and in providing a professional and caring service to the college.
A dedication and willingness for ongoing professional development.
Ability to prioritise, multi-task and autonomous decision making in a high pressure environment.
Application
Apply via our portal by Wednesday, 4 October 2023 at 11:59pm Singapore Time.

UWCSEA welcomes applications from all qualified candidates.

Our school is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all the students in our care and expects all applicants to share this commitment. We follow safe recruitment practices and all appointments are subject to interview, satisfactory references, identity and criminal record checks.

UWCSEA is an equal opportunity employer, and welcomes applications from those who wish to join a community which is inclusive, and which celebrates diversity.

title: Nurse Manager (Home Hospice)
company_info: For the last 56 years, Singapore Cancer Society (SCS) has been minimising the impact of cancer, seeking to bring normalcy and quality of life back to those impacted by cancer. Through its public education, advocacy, cancer screening services, support for cancer research, welfare aid and hospice care and through its various community engagement events, SCS has been working with key partners and rallying the community together in the fight against cancer. As SCS expands and refines its mission to serve more and serve better, we are looking for various talented individuals with an affinity for our cause to join Team SCS. If you believe you have the passion and you can add value to enhance our mission, we are looking for suitable candidates for varius positions in our organization.
job_category: Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services, Social Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join us as a leader and coach who can impact the lives of cancer patients in a home hospice environment and our nurses who care for them.

Reporting to the Director, Cancer Rehab and Supportive Care Services, you will lead and manage a team of home hospice care nurses in providing care in symptom management, patient and caregiver education. You will triage patients into priority groups and liaise with the hospice care doctors and primary specialists in charge of clinical management.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage and coach a team of 8-10 nurses who are the first line of call to patients and caregivers
Lead and support the development needs of the nursing team
Manage nursing manpower in the areas of recruitment, talent retention, schedule planning etc
Acclimate new nurses to the team as a preceptor
Ensure that team reviews are conducted periodically and adopt measures to achieve KPI targets
Ensure compliance to clinical pathways in management.
Manage and maintain adequate stock of medical drugs and equipment.
Oversee and preparing the annual budget in accordance with the organisation’s strategic plan
Conduct assessment and devise a plan of care for all new referrals and ongoing homecare cases.
Conduct regular home visits with the nurses to establish best practices and maintain standards of care
Prioritise care in collaboration with patients and caregivers
Coach nursed in management of pain and other symptoms, including not only physical but also psychosocial and spiritual, ensuring that these are assessed and addressed in a holistic manner instead of episodic care
Provide patient and caregiver education on symptom control and coping skills
Work with multi disciplinary team to provide a support system for patients, families, and caregivers to cope with losses during the patient’s illness journey, as well as bereavement
Work with the related teams to use analytical tools and methods to measure palliative care outcomes of patient’s health over time and influence disease modification by gaining insights to a patient’s illness and dying experience
Qualifications and Experience
A Singapore registered nurse with at least 5-10 years’ experience in leadership
A degree in Nursing or Specialist Diploma in Palliative Care
Experience in Palliative Care is preferred
Strong desire to serve and lead in Palliative Care
Competencies
An astute leader
Strong communicator (written and verbal)
Good management and coaching skills
Clinical supervision skills
Conflict management and resolution skills

title: Nurse Clinician (Infection Control)
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements

The jobholder assesses, implements, and evaluates infection control practices by nursing staff. The jobholder is responsible for staff education and competency in infection control.

Job Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities:

· Assesses, plans, implements, and evaluates infection control practices of nursing staff, doctors and all healthcare workers in AH.
· Conducts teaching for nursing, paramedical and medical staffs and students in infection control practices and guidelines.
· Coordinates and collaborates with other healthcare team members and service providers on infection control practices and guidelines.
· Participates and assist with audits on infection control practices.
· Reviews and develops infection control policies and procedures in consultation with nurse managers, doctors and Infection Prevention Committee
· Compiles information on epidemiological organism and nosocomial infection data and assist with the initiation of actions where necessary.
· Carries out investigations, conducts follow-ups during major outbreaks in the unit and / or hospital.
· Plans, implements, and evaluates in service talks and training courses / activities based on infection control policies.
· Ensures patient care delivery follows established standards of care and infection control policies.
· Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care.
· Assist to prepare reports on infections and other related statistics required by AH, Medical Affairs (Quality Assurance) and / or MOH, and other departments upon requests.

Secondary Responsibilities:

· Acts as a resource person to nursing, medical, paramedics and administrative staff on issues relating to outbreaks and infection control issues. Reports to relevant hospital / medical administrators when required.
· Updates and maintains relevant infection control statistics.
· Participates / leads in quality improvement / research projects.
· Participates / leads in unit-based infection control team.
· Follows up with accidental sharps / mucus membrane exposures to blood and body fluids.
· Informs and notifies wards and relevant staff / or government authority of patients with communicable disease.
· Assists in arranging prompt isolation of infected patients in co-operation with nursing managers / nursing staff.
· Participates / conducts orientation programs for nursing staff and students.
· Assumes additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by the Nurse Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse

Requirements:

· Registered Nurse with at least 7 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Senior Staff Nurse I
· Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board, and certification / prior working experience for a year in infection control.
· Technically skilled, competent, and able to work independently.
· Good interpersonal and communication skills
· Computer literacy skills –MS Word, MS Excel, and PowerPoint

company_info: Founded in 2015, AARO is Singapore’s first independent radiation oncology clinic which has since grown to become an Oncology Group with its own radiation treatment center, ‘Center for Stereotactic Radiosurgery’ situated at Adam Road. Anchored by a multidisciplinary team of Oncologists and Healthcare Professionals who are well-versed in the latest cancer treatments and trends, AARO aims to provide a one-stop solution for each patient’s unique situation – delivering evidence-based medicine and personalized care.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are a Singapore Oncology Specialist Group focussing on the use of state of the art technology to offer targeted and non-invasive treatments for our cancer patients.
We are looking for trained nurses to join our growing and dynamic team. If you are a former nurse who may have taken some time off for your family, studies or other personal pursuits and would like to re-enter the profession, we welcome you to join us.
At AARO, you will work with a team of vibrant and inspiring professionals who are committed and passionate about making a difference in the lives of cancer patients. Find out more about us here > www.aaro.sg

Roles & Responsibilities
· Administer procedure & treatments to ensure well-being of patients
· Dispense medication, administer oral and IV medications
· Communicate and coordinate patient care with other healthcare providers
· Handle general administrative duties
· Record and report clinical information
· Assist the medical staff in the treatment & examination of the patient
· Perform phlebotomy and IV cannulation under minimum supervision
· Assist patients in the various clinical or auxiliary departments as assigned
· Participate in all activities related to the smooth running of the clinic
· Maintain a safe & clean environment for the patients at all times
· Perform any other tasks as assigned by the Clinic Manager

Job Requirements
· At least Diploma in Nursing with minimum 2 years of work experience
· Registered with Singapore Nursing Board
· Possess Basic Care Life Support (BCLS) & Phlebotomy certification
· Good communication and patient interaction skills
· A heart of service
· Team player
· Preferably with experience administering chemotherapy

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary
Responsible to provide personalised, specialised and cost-effective care to patients, in accordance to established hospital policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices. Ensure effective and efficient running of the ward/department assigned.

Job Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities:
Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care of patients
Ensures patient care delivery is carried out according to established standards of care practice using patient care plan / clinical pathways
Co-ordinates patients’ access and treatment sequence where required for the specialty
Conducts teaching and counselling for patients and their families / carers
Initiates and ensures implementation of discharge planning for patients
Leads and participates actively in the review of patients with the multidisciplinary team
Conducts specialty nurse-led clinic for patients and their families where needed
Provides clinical supervision to nurses and nurse trainees to ensure quality patient care delivery
Updates and maintains patient consultation / training statistics / other types of register / registry where appropriate
Applies understanding of prevention of medico-legal issues in relation to patient care
Secondary Responsibilities:
Acts as a resource person for clinical nursing matters
Plans, implements and evaluates in-service staff education and specialty training courses based on unit and individual training needs
Inducts newly graduated advanced diploma nurses in specialty care of a specific group of patients
Guides and develops specialty competencies of registered nurses
Reviews and develops clinical pathways and / or other plans of care in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers, doctors and paramedical staff
Reviews and develops practice policies and guidelines and nursing standards in consultation with specialty nurses, nurse managers and doctors
Assists with nursing audits on nursing care standards
Applies best evidence to practice
Participates in research activities
Undertakes quality improvement / research projects
Participates in training / quality improvement / research committees
Contributes to performance appraisals of enrolled nurses, senior enrolled nurses, staff nurses, senior staff nurses and advanced diploma nursing students
Takes on additional responsibilities or tasks as assigned by Senior Nurse Manager/Clinician, Deputy/Assistant Director (Nursing) and Chief Nurse
Requirements
Registered Nurse with at least 9 years of post-registration clinical experience, of which 2 years must be as Assistant Nurse Clinician
Diploma in Nursing with relevant post-basic advanced certification and Degree in Nursing from recognized training institution as approved by Singapore Nursing Board.

title: Staff Nurse, Cardiovascular
company_info: Developed by The Farrer Park Company, Connexion at Farrer Park will be one of the world’s first truly integrated healthcare and hospitality complexes when it opens in 2014. Professional and end user-driven by objective and design, Connexion comprises Farrer Park Medical Centre, a specialist medical centre; Farrer Park Hospital, a private tertiary hospital; and One Farrer Hotel & Spa, a luxury hotel equipped with state-of-the-art conference and wellness facilities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Provide patient care in Cardiovascular Suite and to assist in the interventional cardiovascular procedures, ensuring compliance with radiology safety policies and procedures for the safety of patients and others.

Main Responsibilities
To plan and manage the care of individual patient using the nursing process approach comprising of Assessment, Planning, Implementation and Evaluation in the Closed Monitoring Unit (CMU). On admission, all necessary pre-procedure check will be done on patient.
To prepare patient for procedure by serving all necessary pre-medications and shaving the appropriate site and monitor the patient closely after a procedure in the CMU and notify the cardiologist/attending doctor of any abnormalities.
To assist in procedures and prepare the various instrument trolleys required in various interventional procedures.
To ensure safety to patient when applying principles of administration of contrast media, taking into consideration the contra-indications and history of patient.
To respond and manage emergency situations in an efficient and calm manner, e.g. in Code Blue.
To perform other assignments as and when required by the Nurse Manager/Clinician.
Job Requirements
Degree / Diploma in Nursing
Post Basic Specialty Certificate/Advanced Diploma in Nursing.
Singapore Nursing Board Practicing Certificate for Registered Nurse.
At least 2-5 years of clinical experience
A minimum of 1 year experience in Cardiology or Radiology interventional procedures or equivalent
5 days work week (Mondays to Fridays, no overnight shift but with extended cases, on-call and callback)

title: Senior Nurse Manager (Central Area)
company_info: Established since 1987, ECON Healthcare Group celebrates more than 30 years of commitment to quality healthcare and eldercare services this year. As a regional provider for integrated healthcare servcies in Singapore, Malaysia and China, the Group incorporates a chain of medicare centres and nursing homes, hospital services, a careskill training centre, a chain of senior services centres, home care services, ambulance services, physiotherapy services and traditional Chinese medicine services. The Group also provides consultancy for the development and management of retirement living communities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Clinical nursing governance
Oversee the implementation of clinical practices including utilisation of new technologies, regular clinical nursing audits to ensure the standards of care is of high quality
Develop new nursing policies and standard operating procedures for continuous improvement
Evaluate and review existing standard operating procedures if the need arise
Collaborate with Centre Managers to review and evaluate the clinical nursing documentations
Lead and direct clinical or service quality activities for all the centres
Develop, implement, monitor and evaluate the quality of nursing care rendered to the residents are in accordance to the ENHS
Carry out periodic clinical audits and analyse the audit results accordingly
Work closely with Centre Managers on action plans for continuing improvement and compliance
Job Redesign
Identify, plan and lead job design initiatives for all staffs
Plan, implement and evaluate effectiveness of job redesign for the different categories of staff
Mentorship
Provide mentorship, guidance and coach staff to work with people and facilitate continuous learning
Provide ongoing supervision to all care staff to ensure delivery of nursing care in meeting organizational goals
Financial Management
Responsible Assist in monitoring of monthly operating expenses and proper inventory control
Monitor the expenditure report of the clinical areas
Review monthly financial performance and variance reports
Evaluate the efficient and effective use of consumables, supplies and dressing materials
Assist in ensuring effective management of resources, cut waste and increase productivity at centre level
Manpower Planning
Assist to coordinate staffing needs and requirements for all centres
Monitor closely manpower based on approved established head counts and MOH guidelines
Secondary Responsibilities and Duties
Assist in coordination of the yearly nursing home strategic planning activities
Assist in building nursing capabilities to support ECON’s initiatives and new services
Act as a resource person on clinical, service and training matters.
Provide counselling session for staff with complex issues
Deputizes Director, Nursing and Assistant Director of Nursing in her absence
Assume any other additional responsibilities assigned by Director, Nursing
Requirements
Registered Nurse, registered with the Singapore Nursing Board and has at least 10 years of working experience in healthcare or related setting
A post-basic qualification in the relevant nursing specialty and with a Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing
More than 5 years of experience in a supervisory capacity
Team player with strong interpersonal communications skill, customer and quality focused

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be an integral part of the team in Care Home to provide classroom and on-the-job training to both clinical and non-clinical staff. You will be responsible of the Induction program for new clinical staff on board.

Job Scope :
Train new clinical staff to ensure and promote quality patient care
Provide timely training schedules as requested/ required
Work, coordinate and support with different institutions (e.g. ITE, AIC, TTSH etc.) to provide training to Support Care Staff
Guide and support assigned Support Care Staff who are in ITE-ISC (ITE Skills Certificate) Healthcare program
Review and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and educational activities for ITE educational programs
Review and revise nursing training curriculum on a regular basis to ensure it meets the current and future educational needs
Utilize best practice standards and guidelines to improve clinical education
Work on training related projects/ assist with assigned projects as needed
Responsible for ensuring all clinical staff receive orientation, training and continual education programs to maintain the required level of competency
Coach and evaluate Support Care Staff after their training to ensure high quality nursing care is delivered to patients
Undertake any other responsibilities as directed by the Supervisor/ Management
Job Requirements
Diploma in Nursing
Registered Nurse with Singapore Nursing Board
Min. 3 years of clinical experience as a Staff Nurse
Experience as Clinical Instructor will be preferred
Valid certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS)
Possess initiative, drive and self-motivation to persevere and make things happen
Able to work effectively with diverse teams and all levels of employees to achieve positive outcomes
People & customer centered
Certified ITE Trainer

title: Assistant Director of Nursing
company_info: A leading VWO that provides social and community services for the benefit of the aged sick and the needy regardless of race, language or religion.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are always looking for the right candidate to expand our team for our new Nursing Home!

Job Responsibilities:
The Assistant Director of Nursing (ADON) assists the DON to direct, organise, plan, coordinate and evaluating administrative, training and managerial activities within the Department of Nursing Services.
Plans, coordinates, evaluates and enforces nursing care services and infection control practices in the clinical area.
Coordinates residential care activities in collaboration with the Nurse Managers and nursing team and being actively involved in direct residents’ care.
Supervises and provides clinical guidance to the healthcare team and identifies and presenting resident care issues for professional trans- and multi-disciplinary discussions at the clinical conferences and other platforms.
Conducting daily nursing rounds to identify clinical and service issues with the aim of addressing and closing gaps in care.
Communicating and collaborating with intra- and inter-departmental staff, residents and relatives.
Knowledge of current and established professional nursing concepts, principles and practices and understand the continuous quality improvement and skills to develop and implement nursing standards of practice.
Participates in continuous quality nursing improvement initiatives, conducts in-service training/education programs, and department and committee meetings as assigned.
Evaluate the nursing team’s performance and guides them in the delivery of safe and quality care.
To participate actively in SNMNH and nursing committees.
Assists the DON in all duties and deputises in his/her absence as needed.
Job Requirements:
Degree in health-related subject or equivalent.
Post-basic certificate / Advanced Diploma in a Nursing speciality.
At least two years of nursing experience in a similar position in a medium or large-sized Nursing Home; or at least 10 years of nursing experience as a Senior Nurse Manager in an acute, community hospital or nursing home. Preference will be given to candidates with Nursing Home experience.
Registered Nurse with current SNB Registration.
Valid BCLS + AED licence.
Minimum basic certificate in Infection Control Prevention and Control.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of current issues in nursing and Nursing Home care.
Good understanding of principles and practices to deliver reliable and safe services.
Proven project management skills, with evidence of delivering large-scale projects.
Demonstrable experience in leading and effectively managing change in large complex environments.

title: Registered Nurse
company_info: Homage is a complete home care solution that combines the curation and training of care professionals with smart technology to provide on-demand home caregiving to seniors, allowing them to age at home with comfort, dignity, control and grace. Using a web and mobile technology platform, Homage efficiently matches care recipients with qualified care professionals and schedules caregiving on an on-demand basis to provide recipients with home nursing care and assistance with daily activities. Homage works with both private clients and public organizations alike to provide high quality caregiving to seniors.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for Registered Nurses who are strongly aligned with our mission to make care more accessible to people in our community.

Depending on your schedule and commitment, we would love to have you on the team as a freelance, short-term contract or full-time nurse.

How you will benefit as a Homage Nurse:
Enjoy high payouts of up to $27/hour
Enjoy a flexible working schedule, so you can choose when you want to work
Expand your nursing experience with multiple job opportunities, including home care and facility-based care (nursing homes, day-care centres, community hospitals)
Get started immediately with the nursing job of your choice
Additional training and upskilling opportunities
Insurance coverage
General responsibilities:
Support with nursing procedures and nursing care (i.e. post-surgery care, medication administration)
Provide general caregiving, personal care & hygiene, and assist with activities of daily living (ADL) (i.e. companionship, showering, toileting, etc)
We will also match your skillsets and preferences with the most suitable opportunity
Minimum qualifications:
Valid Singapore Nursing Board (SNB) practising license
Valid BCLS + AED certificate
Minimum 1 year of experience in a clinical setting
If you are unsure of which job opportunity is right for you, you are encouraged to apply first and a Homage staff will reach out to you to share more.

About Homage
Homage is an award-winning care solution that combines over 8000 curated and trained care professionals with smart technology to manage and provide on-demand holistic home and community-based caregiving to seniors and adults, allowing them to age and recover with grace, control and dignity.
Founded in Singapore, Homage works with care recipients with a range of mobility and medical conditions. We also collaborate with government, health and financial organisations to distribute and deliver caregiving services. We’re proudly backed by a group of top regional investors, including Golden Gate Ventures, 500 Startups and SeedPlus.

~ MW Global Pte Ltd: Hospital-at-Home since 2003 ~

title: Senior / Staff Nurse (Home Care - Locum)
company_info: Established since 1987, ECON Healthcare Group celebrates more than 30 years of commitment to quality healthcare and eldercare services this year. As a regional provider for integrated healthcare servcies in Singapore, Malaysia and China, the Group incorporates a chain of medicare centres and nursing homes, hospital services, a careskill training centre, a chain of senior services centres, home care services, ambulance services, physiotherapy services and traditional Chinese medicine services. The Group also provides consultancy for the development and management of retirement living communities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The jobholder is responsible to provide a patient-centric, personalised, specialised and compassionate care to home care clients’ needs, in accordance with established policies and procedures, standards of nursing care and practices.

Clinical and Psycho-social Aspect:
Responsible for the provision and maintenance of quality and safe clinical services to the homecare clients which includes the following:
Conduct initial clinical assessment of new clients
Conduct 6 monthly review of existing clients and, as and when required when condition changes.
Formulate individualised and holistic care plan, and review whenever required.
Ensure proper and accurate nursing documentation.
Perform nursing procedures in accordance with the core competencies as a Registered Nurse as specified by Singapore Nursing Board.
Work closely with multi-disciplinary team comprising of Allied Health Professionals, Registered Medical Practitioner, etc.
Liaise and communicate directly with clients and sponsors regarding any issues that may arise and provide solutions.
Provide psycho-social support, such as establishing effective communication and understanding their psycho-social needs, etc.
Liaise with clients and other stakeholders to refer to other relevant services, such as counselling, occupational therapy, dietetic, etc.
Administrative and Operations Support
Assist Senior Staff Nurse/Homecare Manger in supporting the daily operations of the home care department which includes the following:
Handling home care enquiries and provide financial counselling when necessary.
Providing administrative support, managing feedback, complaints and identifying situations where clients require additional attention, etc.
Collaborating with other related departments, such as IT, finance, etc., to ensure smooth operational flow of the Home Care business.
Coordinating clients’ care arrangements, such as rostering, rotating 24 hours on-call basis for emergencies, etc.
Achieve the set targets in meeting the profitability of the department.
Manpower Development and Support
Provide training and supervision to the team of care staff, when required.
Plan and coordinate the assignments of care staff according to their job scope and competencies based on client’s care needs.
Assist to manage a team of care staff and monitor their performances and developments.
Assist to oversee the well-being of care staff and manage any staff issues, when required, eg. conflict management, clients’ feedback about staff, etc.
Quality Service and Incident Management
Lead quality improvement projects and initiatives
Identify risks, mitigate and perform service recovery
Conduct relevant audits in areas of job scope
Manage and report any incident, and escalate when management decision is required
Other Duties
Perform adhoc duties and responsibilities, as assigned by Homecare Head
Cover duties of care coordinator, during his/her absence, if necessary
Requirements:
Possess a Bachelor Degree in related field and/or Degree or Advanced Diploma or Diploma in Nursing will be an added advantage
State Registered Nurse with valid practicing license issued by the Singapore Nursing Board
Valid certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS)
At least 8 years’ experience in management of department and have provide supervision to a team of subordinates

company_info: Alliance is a reliable medical brand trusted by more than 1,000,000 individuals in the region, a healthcare organisation specialising in corporate health solutions, a leading wholesale pharmaceutical company facilitating timely access of cutting-edge medications to the region, and a safe haven where our patients can count on their friendly family doctors and medical specialists to treat their health problems. As a physician-led and physician-owned healthcare organisation, we know what is important to those who matter to us – our patients. Since our inception, quality healthcare and evidence-based medical treatment for our patients have always been our priorities. At Alliance, we strive to be a next-generation healthcare company that harnesses the power of technologies and patient data to provide cost-effective and efficient services for our patients and corporate clients. The intelligence from our data of over 1,000,000 healthcare users offers us insights into disease trends and healthcare utilisation, which empower our corporate clients and insurance partners to maximise their returns on their health dollar as well as improve the delivery of care. Since our establishment in 1994, Alliance has grown from a humble clinic into a technology-driven healthcare organisation with multi-faceted services and a global presence in China, Japan, India, Malaysia, Israel, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. At Alliance, keeping our patients healthy and happy is our top priority.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Opportunity
We are currently seeking highly skilled and dedicated Staff Nurse to join our prestigious Executive Health Screening Centre. As a key member of our healthcare team, you will play a vital role in delivering exceptional patient care and ensuring the smooth operation of our state-of-the-art facility. If you are a registered nurse qualified in Singapore and possess the necessary skills and experience, we invite you to apply for this rewarding position.

How you will make an impact
Perform and administer a wide range of clinical duties, including taking medical history, administration of patient questionnaires, performing health screening tests, phlebotomy, injections, conducting ECGs and administering treadmill stress tests etc.
Manage administrative tasks such as managing appointments, organizing patient records, and maintaining accurate documentation.
Prepare comprehensive medical reports based on test results and provide recommendations for further evaluation or treatment.
Operate clinic CMS (Clinical Management System) to input patient data, update medical records, and generate reports.
Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure efficient patient flow and timely delivery of services.
Educate patients on health screening procedures, answer their inquiries, and provide guidance on maintaining optimal health.
Adhere to strict infection control protocols and maintain a clean and safe working environment.
Continuously update your knowledge and skills through professional development opportunities and stay informed about the latest advancements in health screening practices.
Requirements
At least 3 years of relevant experience in a healthcare setting, preferably in a similar role
Proven experience in performing nursing duties and administration of health screening tests
Familiar with operating CMS system and preparing medical reports
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities to manage administrative tasks effectively.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact with patients, colleagues, and other healthcare professionals.
Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in recording patient information and test results.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle potentially stressful situations with professionalism and empathy.
Registration with Singapore Nursing Board
BCLS (Basic Cardiac Life Support) certification

To know more about Alliance Healthcare Group Limited, visit us at www.alliancehealthcare.com.sg

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
As a Staff Nurse, you will:
Fulfill the role of Overall Nurse-in-charge, overseeing daily operations.
Supervise nursing staff during your shift, ensuring high-quality patient care.
Provide guidance to senior nurses during complex procedures and wound care.
Maintain ward tidiness and promptly address resident needs.
Conduct regular rounds to monitor resident conditions and well-being.
Administer medications and perform senior nursing treatments.
Educate residents, relatives, and handle emergencies.
Ensure accurate nursing chart updates, vital signs recording, and care plans.
Maintain cleanliness of medication storage areas and treatment rooms.
Collaborate with medical professionals for Multi-Disciplinary Rounds.
Participate in Quality Assurance, Fire Safety, and Emergency Response Committees.
Mentor new Staff Nurses and Enrolled Nurses.
Conduct annual performance appraisals and KPI reports for assigned teams.
Qualifications:
State Registered Nurse certification from the Singapore Nursing Board.
Basic Cardiac Life Support training.
Relevant nursing qualification, such as a Diploma or Bachelor of Science in Nursing.
Fresh Nursing grads are welcome to apply too.
Benefits:
Professional development opportunities.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.
Contribution to the well-being of residents in a dynamic healthcare setting.
If you're a dedicated nurse seeking a fulfilling role in a healthcare environment, we welcome your application. Join our team and make a difference in the lives of our residents while advancing your nursing career. Apply now!

title: Senior / Staff Nurse (Multidisplinary)
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities:
• Assesses patients’ needs on admission and on daily basis throughout their hospital stay
• Plans and implements care according to the assessed needs
• Evaluates and monitors patients’ progress according to planned care
• Documents care given and monitors outcomes on the established charts and forms
• Delivers safe and competent nursing care
• Participates actively in physicians’ rounds
• Carries out treatments and investigations as prescribed by physicians
• Collaborates and co-operates with physicians and other health-care providers in the smooth delivery of patient care and services
• Communicates and discusses patients’ progress and response to treatment with physicians, nursing and allied health colleagues involved in the patient care
• Provides patient/family with information and education on disease prevention, health education and rehabilitation techniques
• Ensures continuity of patient care and treatment plans through follow-ups
• Displays compassion, a positive and caring attitude towards patients
• Adhere to proper use and care of equipment
• Maintains a clean and safe working environment
Secondary Responsibilities:
• Supervises and guides nursing students, new joiners, graduated registered nurses and junior staff in their work
• Participates in clinical and service quality activities
• Keeping abreast with current nursing and health care practices
• Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned by Nursing Management Team

Requirements
• Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board (SNB)
• Diploma or Degree in Nursing from recognized training institutions approved by SNB
• Good interpersonal and communication skills
• Compassionate, positive and caring nature
• Possess good clinical skills and knowledge
Mon to Fri: 8am to 5pm (requires to work wekends at times and may need to support inpatient ward/taking case load when manpower needs arise)
Gerontology or inpatient ward exp required
Must be holding Full Registration under SNB

title: Enrolled Nurse
company_info: SUNLOVE ABODE FOR INTELLECTUALLY-INFIRMED LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Enrolled Nurse is responsible for providing basic nursing care and patient education under the supervision and direction of a registered nurse, in collaboration with the healthcare teams according to the established policies, procedures and guidelines. He/She attends relevant nursing trainings to ensure that his/her skills remain up-to-date to provide patients with quality nursing care. He/She provides coaching for newly joined enrolled nurses, students and support care staff.
- Carry out individualised planned nursing interventions for the residents
- Support transitional care plans
- Assist in procedures and treatments
- Adhere to infection control and prevention practices in resident care activities
- Teach residents, caregivers and family members proper techniques in self-care
- Provide feedback on risk assessment and quality management activities
- Support supervision of support care staff and enrolled nurse trainees in performing basic nursing care activities
- Perform health assessment of residents' condition
- Monitor residents for early signs and/or deterioration of residents' condition using appropriate assessments and observations
- Familiar with the use of Nursing Home IT Enablement Program (NHELP) process

AWS &VB
Career progression
Job Description:
Perform clinical and patient assessments before, during, and after dialysis treatment to assess the quality of care.
Adhere to all relevant policies and work instructions concerning clinical and operational management.
Evaluate blood test results and promptly notify the Medical Director of any detected abnormalities.
Work as a registered nurse in a dialysis centre.
Monitor patients' vital signs and engage in conversations to evaluate their health status.
Supervise the entire dialysis procedure, ensuring its smooth progression.
Administer prescribed medications to patients, following doctors' orders accurately.

Diploma/Degree in Nursing and registered with Singapore Nursing Board
Candidates with prior renal experience will be an advantage
Passionate to improve the quality of life of renal patients and strive to provide the highest standards of care
Certified and valid Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS)
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Entry level candidates are welcome to apply
